description:
I love Kilowatt ...my liver not so much.

I do not come here very often anymore but when I am in the neighborhood I love  taking visiting guests from out of town here...and their response??  Gosh I wish we had one of these back home!

Yeah no chit! 

Great beers on tap. Mixed drinks. Cheap pool table.

Patrons are chill

Great rock and roll vibe with a rowdy juke box 

You can bring in outside food as well ( that's a win, win, win !!!!)
author: David G.

description: It hasn't changed and still has character. It's a great place to meet up and chit chat the night away. Ahhh, I love the Mission bars and suicide girls. Cheers to Dr Winkie! Lol!
author: Moneey P.

description:
Besides cash needed to order up drinks and maybe renting of the game supplies, I like this divey spot, which is a rarity these days in the Mission.  

If it is divey, it would be contemporary and not that old school vibe you get. 

Darts, pool tables and pinball machines for the most part on entertainment.  Also, TV to watch sports' games.

Casual and chill at its finest.
author: Tiffany D.

description: If there's only one dive bar you visit in the inner Mission, please go to Kilowatt. Best place to drink and go shoot some pool. I used to play in a bar league and this is where we would meet up for some practice.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
This place usually has chill bar staff and cheap drinks.

Brought a large group straight in after a BYOB show  around the corner to hang out and celebrate and buy drinks. We brought in a single bag of leftover food and the remaining couple cans of warm leftover beer and set it aside and left it untouched with our jackets for the remainder of the evening. The bar tender was awesome, friendly, and courteous, we spent a couple hours there and bought quite a few beverages, but a dark-haired curly-headed bar back passing by stopped and curtly pointed at our bag asked what was in the bag. Because I wasn't hiding anything I told him "Leftover food and warm beer". We were instructed to leave "immediately", even after explaining it was from earlier, we had no intention of drinking it, and he could actually take it. He really rudely insisted "No, out right now".

The shade we were thrown killed our night, and we left really bummed. I left the beer they kicked us out over because it was unimportant, and I wanted them to know that.

The drinks are cheap, and the vibe is kinda cool, but killing our buzz ruined the night. Not really interested in going back.
author: Colton R.

description:
This place was a decent dive bar on the scale of dive bars found all across SF.  I wasn't carrying cash and I wasn't going to use the ATM since I didn't believe in paying surcharges for accessing my money.  They had a decent amount of beer selections and based on my companions who went with me, they poured their drinks on the heavy alcohol side.  Good value for the money if you like a heavy handed cocktail.

They have a variety of games like darts and pool but the majority of our group stayed in a booth near the front where the ATM was located.  I chatted with the people lining up which was probably the most entertaining part of my night there.  

Was worth the visit although I'm not a dive bar kind of guy, I did enjoy my stay here.
author: Ben H L.

description: This bar is a good option to go with a group of people, as there is plenty of space and low cash-only prices for drinks, especially beer. There are lots of pool tables available as well, and a semi-dive bar atmosphere
author: Clayton B.

description:
A bartender physically assaulted me (grabed a cup out of my literal mouth and spilled it on me) at 1:50 am. Proceeded to comment about how I "have to be at work at Google tomorrow". If you're into super judgemental and off-putting staff, this place might be for you. 
Honestly, I don't write positive or negative reviews about places often, but this guy was such a complete douche that in felt it was necessary. If you want a dive bar in the area with actual decent people behind the bar, go to Delirium. At least they treat their customers like human beings. The staff at Kilowatt make this place complete garbage.
author: Michael J.

description: Great staff! Great company. Almost feels like family. Tyler the bartender is awesome. Also a plus- they have complimentary popcorn
author: Zara I.

description:
I come here all the time. Great dive bar to shoot some pool, play some darts and even Pacman! Can get pretty crowded on the weekend, but thankfully it's not the tiniest bar in the Mission.

Most drinks are around $5-7 

In order to get the darts- you must give the bartender $10/your ID that they'll hold onto until you return the darts. Guess someone must have ran away with the darts in the past. Sadly, from the last time I was there, looks like something happened to one of the dart boards so try to get the dart board to the left if you can.
author: Arezou A.

description: Visiting from out of town. Great time here, very eclectic. Cash only though so be ready
author: Ed G.

description: Staff were friendly. Ambience is great. Four stars because the regulars at the pool tables are nothing short of a disgrace to the game - no tact or understanding of billiard fundamentals. The wall also interferes with the game. Stick to drinks and darts.
author: Alexander G.

description: Good place for group hangout. Cheap drinks but they do only take cash. Strictly a beer place so if you want cocktails, look somewhere else.
author: Kaya D.

description: This waiter shut off everything my gay friends played at the bar including Ace of Base and Spice Girls. They payed money for these songs at the jukebox and this bartender literally said "I don't like this gay shit". Shame on you.
author: J C.

description: This place had fantastic service even when it was really busy. They also returned my wife's iPhone X when she left it there like some class acts. Well done fellas.
author: Frank D.

description: In San Francisco for the fist time and I wanted to watch some football games on Sunday, I came here because a bar down the street was way too crowded and I am very happy it was. The bartender was very attentive and put the Texans game on a convenient screen without me asking just because he saw my hat. I also saw him run out of the bar to chase someone down that forgot their sunglasses! Great people great vibes great bar!
author: Paco S.

description:
For my 350th Four Star Review, I wanted to share a cool bar in SF.  We were on a mission to party, meet some chicks, and finish at La Taqueria El Cumbre in the Mission.  After walking around a bit, we decided to drop by Kilowatt located on 16th near Valencia in SF.  BTW, this bar is cash only.

Everything about this bar is chill. The customers are cool, and engaging.  No one tries to slide by you at the bar, order drinks and stay to crowd you out, a la Tasting Kitchen in Venice.  In addition, the bartenders are cool.  They let you have a taste of beer, know their handles, and pour stiff drinks.  Lastly, the ambiance is cool.  There are a couple of pool tables, and darts in rear.  The women are friendly too.  I met Christine from SF, who was a very nice person, that could carry on an intelligent convo.

All I can say is "Mission" accomplished!  We warmed up here, took Christine and her friend to Elbo Room & Asia SF, and got a late lite snack.  I can't wait to return and complete another mission!  LMAO!!!
author: Joe P.

description:
Typical dive bar in the mission

With it's eye-catching sign, it's hard to miss this place when walking down one of the busiest streets in the mission!

The inside is pretty divey, as expected. Packed with people on a saturday night, mostly because of it's location. The booths and chairs feel slimy, and the cups they use to serve the beer look a little disgusting, with a weird "moldy" smell.

The clientele looks like they're ready to party, though. The atmosphere is pretty good--everyone's chatting, and you can feel the energy in the air.

Overall, a good place to go if you're looking for a divey bar
author: Henry L.

description: Honestly, A BANGER. Me n my homegirl always sit in the back by the the crapper and get to scope out all the BADDIES walking in and out of the bathroom. Really great atmosphere, Jared the bartender (I think that's his name) always hooks it up with the $3 olympia's (my GO-TO drink). Sometimes the bouncer Connor forgets my name but I'll let it slide. I also can't forget about the amazing outdoor seating. To the right of the bar there's this SICK alley called Albion, yeah you know what happens on Albion stays on Albion. 10/10 would recommend. I've contemplated buying a hoodie to rep my fave dive bar here in the mission, but they haven't re-uped on size smalls....ANYWAY You'll probably catch me here every friday-sunday. Lightweight low key LIT bar.
author: Tess M.

description: Awesome, friendly place to chill w/the locals (the few that are left)! The entitled and bougie types can step on, we actually wanna have fun here.
author: Carol C.

description:
Dude bar. San Francisco use to be cool, san francisco use to be cold.
Women, we can do better... let this be a sausage fest.
author: Jane D.

description:
Let's make this a Packers bar, y'all! It kinda already is but I saw some VERY sad Cowboys fans there last week. Don't yuck my yum, losers! Jk They're humans and I love them.

Great selection of affordable beers. Staff is really nice. TVs all over the place so any spot is a good spot to catch a game. They also have free hot dogs on Sundays. Free is my favorite word.

This is a DIVE BAR so it's got that dingy, dark, kinda gross feeling so I feel really clean in comparison. Great for my self esteem and personal hygiene.
author: Katey W.

description:
Kilowatt isn't my favorite but my husband loves coming here to have some drinks and play some pool. The place is big and the bartenders are nice. The ambience can get a little bit rough sometimes but nothing major. They have two pool tables and lots of places to seat. 

Kilowatt is close to other bars, and restaurants so it's definitely a place to start and then move forward to another bar, it's also close to bart and located in the middle of everything. Weekends they have a live DJ and they open their back room and you can dance.
author: Suzy R.

description:
Great spot and a staple for drinking in the mission.  Bar has it all, pool, darts, classic arcade games.  It's a pretty open space with plenty of seating.  Pool is a big deal here, so come to play...
Was there on a Monday and had the best bartender I've had in a min.  I believe her name was D and she was everything one would want in a bartender: hot, funny conversation, and remembered all 5 of our drinks with 0 problem.
Crowd was a decent mix of dudes:girls and vibe was upbeat and relaxed.
author: Chris P.

description:
Seriously had one the worst experiences here last weekend & I didn't even get to buy a drink... The bouncer was clearly racist and made a "fresh off the boat" joke whilst checking our ids. He was adamant that my friend was not 25 and had the audacity to revoke the rest of my groups entry. Which was embarrassing because I was hosting a large group of people from out of state. Way to give them the San Franciscan Hello with a racial remark. By the way, the bouncer is a white guy with dreadlocks... so that explains a lot. 

Maybe next time I'll be able experience the inside of the bar & buy a drink. 

Choose wisely on whom you hire. Be professional. You're running a business.
author: Don S.

description:
We love this bar!
It has the Ms. Pac-Man/Galaga arcade for 50 cents a play!!!
Fun, fun, fun!
author: JC M.

description:
Meh to their drinks. Ordered a kamikaze but it tasted like straight sugar. Ugh what a waste of calories...

Dirty tables. Ordered two Moscow mules and they came in two different glasses which means two different sizes. 

Only half of us were carded. The girls that sat down were not carded while the boys that ordered us drinks were. Some more friends came and they were stopped at the door. 

Too many inconsistency.
author: Serena F.

description: For a dive bar, this is pretty good.  The drinks are reasonably priced, and they also have free popcorn courtesy of a popcorn machine.  Great service too.
author: a f.

description: Kilowatt is a rare find: a friendly, downright cheap sports bar inside the city limits. Low price beers and good TVs made this an awesome place to watch the Cubs win game 7 in extra innings. Go Cubs, Go! And Go Kilowatt.
author: Bill F.

description: I've never had a good time here. I asked a bartender if it was cash only and he was all "YOURE IN THE MISSION ARENT YOU??!!!" Uhhhhhh it was just a question no need to get all cray. And I ended up withdrawing my life savings to buy shots for everyone so it's not like I wasn't going to spend my money here. Whack whack whack. So many better dive bars in the Mission. I don't even like Casanova but I would go there any day to avoid Kilowatt.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I LOVE this bar! I just recently discovered it but I've already been twice and I'll probably keep coming back here. This bar is conveniently located on 16th St. pretty close to 16th St. Bart in the midst of lots of other bars and clubs. This bar has a more divey feel: there's darts, pool, arcade games and plenty of seating. The first time I came here for darts on a Tuesday evening and it wasn't hard to get a dart board. The second time, I came here to watch the warriors game because all the other bars in the mission were too crowded and this ended up being a great spot to watch! We easily got seats and the drinks were so cheap - $5 for gin and tonics! Yes please! They were playing the game on 4 screens and there was a great vibe! I'll definitely be back again :)

Tip: Cash only! But they have an ATM inside so don't fret if you forget.
author: Malika R.

description: My favorite bar in the city, all the bartenders are amazing. Everyone is always super chill, great music and company. Also if you're looking for a challenging pool opponent anyone on the table will teach you a thing or two. Good food next door check this place out if you're in the area. They have like a million great beers on tap.. I may have exaggerated a little lol but it's bomb
author: Flower F.

description:
Kilowatt is a local favorite. It's always full of Mission locals during the week and it's a popular destination for locals all over the city. It's a typical dive bar, no frills...which is probably why a lot of people like it. There are also a bunch of other dive bars and amazing restaurants on this street so it's a perfect destination for some bar hopping. 

On the weekends they open the back room and they have dancing and a DJ and it's really fun. People go all out and get down. Good spot to take a date.

Overall, great dive bar option.
author: Juliet S.

description:
The bikers and hipsters which fill the space between the cute-dog-picture-covered walls of this fine establishment are going to have a West-Side-Story-esque Sharks and Jets rumble one of these days.

And I hope to god I'm there for it... and that I've already give them my $10 and left my ID for one of the two sets of darts.

Note: DO NOT FORGET ID and $10 when you return the darts. the drinks are strong.

favorite sign above the bar I want to "borrow": "you're in the mission"
author: Mike V.

description:
One of the stalwarts of the Mission 'Dive Bar' scene the Kilowatt has watched as their neighbors have changed names, and styles, over the years.  Their formula is simple Beer, Pool, Sports....I like all 3 so this place is a winner!
I'll be back soon!
author: Jim P.

description: To the person that just tagged the bartender as racist! He never once said the word 'gay' and in the event that you played the whole ace of base album, it was cut off due to the entire bar complaining about the music. Please be honest in your reviews cause calling out 'racist' is just awful. This bar and bartender are far from that.... I was here the whole time and you guys were just plain rude!
author: Rebecca R.

description: Cheap beers (for SF at least), good vibe, most Portland,Oregon esque bar I've been able to find. A good place to spend your hard earned cash (only)
author: Abigail S.

description: Place was on a street with lots of bars, but this one was bumpin! Loved the pools tables. Vibe was weird though. Everyone was pretty hammered and no one seemed friendly to us strangers lol. But otherwise was a pretty cool place. Clean and very warm inside. Jukebox...good prices.
author: Gee R.

description:
So many great memories here, this place is a gem, I've been here a hundred times in the past decade+.  

Like the quintessential Mission dive bar, it's unpretentious, has a few canines at times, serves strong drinks and good beer, and is distinctly lacking in decor.  Bartenders are no nonsense but friendly enough, just be ready to order end don't ask for something fancy or stupid and you'll be alright.  

I love Kilowatt.
author: Saminda W.

description: I'm 26 years old. I showed up to this bar at 8:30 pm or so on Saturday night, 1/14. I was not drunk (I had just come from a comedy show) and was only hoping to meet an old friend for a beer before heading home. I had TWO forms of valid identification on me AND one expired ID (that had expired a few months prior). The bartender did not let me in, claiming that I was using someone else's ID (despite having two separate forms of ID that also matched the name on my credit cards).  Yes, my ID photo was taken when I was 17 years old. I still have never had a problem like that before in my life, especially with multiple forms of identification for confirmation. This was a very insulting experience and I will not be coming back.
author: Eliot W.

description:
I love this place for its raised darts area in the back -- darts are available from the bar with an ID and a $10 deposit.

This bar also features my favorite pinball machine of all time - themed after one of the best video games of all time: Rollercoaster Tycoon.
author: Jack H.

description: Watch out for racist bouncer. While guy with dreads, he's hard to miss. My friends and I just tried to get in and he says their IDs look like they're 'Fresh off the Boat.' Not okay
author: Casey T.

description:
Definitely a solid Mission bar.  So glad that we decided to stop by Kilowatt.

Kilowatt is definitely a large bar, with room for pool tables, pinball machines, darts, tables and stools all around.  And on NYE, definitely accommodated a good number of people.  The vibe is very diverse here - you'll get people from different walks of life enjoying themselves on VERY well priced drinks (always a huge plus).  From what I remember, our beers (of which they have a very nice selection) and gin & tonics came out to about $5 each, which really surprised our group.  And the bartenders are super nice! Will definitely be making it back to Kilowatt.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Props to my homegirl Jaime H. for finding this little spot for watching Football on Sunday afternoons. They play all the football games, plus there was some baseball action going on this past weekend too. GO GIANTS! 

The drinks were between $4 and 6, they let you bring in outside food and the bartenders and patrons are friendly - even if they are rooting for the opposite team. The overall vibe was fun and positive, we had a blast and were there for awhile.

Dive right in, the bar is fun....
author: Rebekah T.

description:
CASH ONLY  - ATM is at the front of this bar.

one of the few places you can watch sports in the mission. we were trying to watch the Blackhawks Red Wings game, and realized this is a red wings bar (but go Hawks). although we arrived after the game ended, it's still a good tip to know.

the roller coaster tycoon pinball machine was broken, so they gave us our 75 cents back. that was a nice touch for a busy saturday night.

I had a great time here, and will definitely be back.
author: Kailey O.

description:
I came here for a drink with a friend after having dinner at Pakwan, and...I think this may be one of my new favorite bars!

Tip: Cash only (as are most places in the Mission) so make sure to bring your dollar bills!

Kilowatt is a dive bar but full of many surprises - two of which being darts and erotic photo hunt. This is where I learned to play darts for the first time and it was SO FUN! Specifically, I learned how to play cricket. I can't wait to play it again. They don't charge a fee for playing darts - you just have to give them your ID and a $10 deposit, which you will get back once you return the darts.

They also have a game machine which consists of an entire erotic section. I love me some good photo hunt, so when my friend said that there was such a thing as erotic photo hunt, I just had to try it for myself. And guess what? The machine at Kilowatt had it. So funny. Definitely a good drinking game. It's all photos from like the '80s so you really don't need to worry about the pictures...although some do get distracting. LOL. And you can pick from males or females. 

Kilowatt also has pool tables, although we didn't get around to playing pool, and two arcade style game machines as well. I think one was pinball...and not sure what the other was cause I was focused on my dart game (pst...which I won...maybe that's why I had so much fun haha).

Love the mix of entertainment and pretty affordable drinks. Wee!!
author: Jennifer T.

description:
One of my favorite things to do is just go across 16th Street between Kilowatt and Gestalt until I get drunk enough to need to grab a burrito off MIssion Street before going home. 

Seriously, it's one of my very favorite things in this world.
I don't know if i'll ever get sick of it.

Even if you're not making a night out of Kilowatt, it's the single best bar to start your night in the Mission. The single best.

It's a dive bar without any pretenses. It's cash only because duh, you're in the mission. Hence the sign above the bar.

Getting a table with your friends really isn't too difficult and there's pool and pin ball if the people your friends brought along bore you. I can't think of anything not to love about this place.
author: K M.

description:
Next to the last stop on our slow, boozy crawl through The Mission.

When we walked in, the fun hit us like a slap in the face.

I wish we had shown up earlier!

Even though it was packed in this large space, I managed to wrangle a table and chairs for our group of 8.

We chilled out to some good music, while we watched people playing pool on the main floor and darts in a small, raised alcove in the back of the bar.

They have an intense beer selection that could please anyone, and would the cheap prices.

Add this place to your list of bars to hit up on 16th Street!
author: Diana V.

description:
Kilowatt sits on an eccentric corner amongst many other bars with crowds, loud music and near dark alley ways. The street lights on Mission paved a carpet to lead you inside. 

Outside are those hanging out, doing drunk people things, smoking a cloud of happiness and the guy who checks your id, seems a little gone. No trouble getting inside.

Loud music, but I love the retro feeling of this bar! There were tables everywhere, crowded and wet. Pool tables were in the back, alongside with a PacMan machine. At the bar, it took about five minutes for us to squeeze and grab the bartenders attentions, but he dove in took our orders and made me happy. I had the stronger vodka cran in a while, it was literally all vodka and a splash a cran for possible the pink color. 

It's cash only but atm outside. They serve about over 50+tap beers and they're only 4$. It's a chill bar to hang out at. The best part is the retro cash register! It was old school and that really completed everything for me. 

Last call was exactly at 130am for us on a Saturday night. They're serious about it, closing doors and I barely got out! 

Great place to be. Loud music. Good people. Great bartenders. And pool tables! Parking is a slight bitch, but it's alright. Mission, I take my hat off to you.
author: Winnie G.

description: Great!!! But does not allow dogs anymore. Please note :) I had to find a new place because of the pooch. But it's still a great bar
author: Carlee M.

description: Awesome place. Walked in and was able to get a super fast. Cheap drinks and amazing service. I willl definitely be back!
author: Michelle M.

description: Standard dive bar - Came here to kill some time with friends during happy hour and played a couple rounds of pool. Good draft selection at good prices!
author: Hannie E.

description:
Part of me has dreaded writing this review. Kilowatt is, after all, the reason I couldn't stand to look at, or even think about, liquor for a good month, and the reason I didn't visit Mission again for another five. Or, well, I suppose the real reason is that I did a poor job of holding my liquor, but Kilowatt was certainly the enabling factor here!

Dropping by with the birthday girl after a dinner at Morac, I was shocked by how insanely packed the place was. There was no seating available, and even standing room was limited - being in a wheelchair, and thus shorter, also proved unfortunate, as many a person ended up tripping over me as they waded their way through the masses. Eventually, as I was feeling inclined to hightail out of there, two booths opened up in the corner.

The drinks here are inexpensive though, and their shots are actually almost double the standard size. And... that's about all I remember, because once midnight hit, and my sixth or seventh double shot disappeared down my throat, so did a 11 hour chunk of my memory (I kid you not), that involved (from what I could piece together from friends) my disappearance, losing my phone (which I later found was picked up by a crackhead and sold to someone I can only assume was a prostitute), and somehow managing to push my way back to SOMA, almost two miles away, through Mission, in the early hours of the morning.

Now, the low rating has nothing to do with this ridiculous experience, no no. If anything, it's probably one of the best, and scariest, stories of excessive drinking I have. The real reason is simply how obscenely packed this place gets - if not for that, I'd easily give these guys a three. But, as it is, I can't see myself coming back by choice, as I much prefer lounging around somewhere a bit less crowded, with drinks that are a bit fancier.
author: Johnny W.

description: The people at the door made racist comments and were extremely rude just because I forgot to leave my bear bottle inside. You just can't have a person with zero manner at such a place.
author: Basheer S.

description:
Thank god for Kilowatt.

I've lived in the Mission for over four years and I miss how grungy 16th street bars used to be. Slowly the hipsters, bikers, and neighborhood crew has been displaced by a crowd you'd expect to see in the Marina. (Btw, no offense meant to our city's Marina residents. It's a beautiful neighborhood and has some great local businesses, but I don't necessarily want that "scene" everywhere.) Anyway, before I distress too far (too late, right?), I'm thankful that Kilowatt has remained largely the same.

It's a large bar with a good mix of booths and stand up tables near the entrance, and opens up to a couple pool tables and an elevated dart board area in the back. The drinks are cheap, the bartenders are nice, and the regulars are generally great conversation. They've got an ample amount of televisions, so while this isn't a "sports bar", you could definitely watch the game there. They've also got a Naked Photo Hunt console at the far end of the bar, which is the BEST group bar game next to Big Buck Hunter.
author: Madhu P.

description:
I have never seen such bigotry, misogyny, xenophobia, and hatred at an otherwise "chill" place. The bouncer Mike made sneering remarks that I should teach my fiance "how to be American." I calmly said he needs to be more polite to us, but it got worse. 

He then led people standing outside the door to heckle our group, saying "this is America," "go home," etc. One person threated a member of our group, saying "you don't know what I can do to you. I have a lawyer... I can kill you." Several peole tried to grab belongings from a member of our group. Another person standing next to the bouncer said "take your bitch before I take her instead" to a female member of our group. People followed us down the street telling us to "go home."

The bouncer did nothing to control the group harrassment. It is the bouncer's job to keep order at the door, not harass and encourage intimidation of patrons. I'm incredibly disappointed by this hateful, xenophobic behavior tolerated by this business. I hope people will avoid going here while Mike is there.
author: Laura G.

description: We couldn't get inside because they don't allow dogs. Then I see here in Yelp that they have a wall with dogs' pics
author: Gerson P.

description:
Killowatt is in the heart of the Mission, and offers a HUGE selection of moderately priced drafts (~$4) and pitchers (~$15). The place is a pretty big draw area with its deep seating, pool tables, TVs and music. 

It gets a good crowd going in the evening and is a great stop after a great burrito in the area
author: Vince E.

description:
Great bar! 
My first time here I went to visit with an old friend and it was a fun laid back atmosphere.
author: Laurel C.

description:
I was initially going to giordano's to watch the giants play game 6 of the world series, but since my friends and I came late, we couldn't get a table.  We were standing in line for a while when this guy  told us there's some place down the street letting people in.

I went to scope it out and sure enough, everyone was free to come and go in Kilowatt.  Their beer selection was pretty good and the prices could not be beat (I got three beers and it came out to $12).

I was also a fan of the chill atmosphere.  There were people who were bringing in pizza (from next door?) and just eating it and watching the game.  The bartenders were super nice and attentive.  I felt like I was served in a short amount of time even though it was a mad house in there.  

The other customers also seemed to be very friendly people.  Perhaps it was the mood of the city celebrating Giants in the world series again, but some random stranger bought me a drink (and not in a weird creepy way, but in a friendly way).

Will definitely come back when it's not so packed.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Dive bar with open dog policy! All the random nights I've come here, I've always managed to see 1-2 dogs lurking about~ which is the BEST. I also love that they have a wall FULL of dog portraits. 

Decent prices for drinks, pool tables, and pac man machine in the back. Only wish that there's more seating when it gets too crowded. 

TLDR: such doge, much dive.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Sweet  spot mellow vibes..just not really anything special..grab a drink and go place.
author: Chandler P.

description:
Sundays are the time to be here! Such a great crowd with understanding bartenders. The patrons are from all over and have their personal alliances to football teams from all over the country. It is a fun time. 

Fantastic dive bar. Sunday home. Affordable draught beer!

Notes: CASH ONLY. Staff does allow outside food if you purchase drinks from them! There are awesome carryout places nearby.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Kilowatt is a pretty neat place if you come here during down time. Great beer selection and billiard & darts available to play. 

Things to know:
1) You need cash - Wells Fargo and Bank of America are on 16th and Mission
2) $1 to play pool - they to get the pool table closest to the door - the second one is close to the wall so its sometimes hard to play off of it
3) Bring your food from Patawan and have yourself some dinner and games
4) Happy hour is from 4-7 pm

I really enjoy this place bc it has a great mixture of locals and people from outside the mission. Place is a little dark but doesn't hurt the place. I recommend this place if you are in this area!
author: Pablo P.

description: nice local atmosphere. Lots of beer option and everyone was pretty laid back.
author: Katie R.

description:
Came here to hang out with my birthday girl YuJin for her pre-birthday partay and had a blast! I actually didn't shoot any pool because I'm so rusty and I really don't want to get back into it again (addictive personality) but I certainly enjoyed watching others play! 

There were some old schoolers here, and everyone seemed to know each other. Although I was just an observer, many of the players were really friendly and talked to me about their experiences, and who plays what kind of games with what kind of an attitude (sneak-attacks, assholish, cry-baby, brutes, etc.). 

I think we were the only three Asian girls here (and one lady plays for the gal's team) so Yuj and I got our fair share of random, Asian-fetishist men using cheeseball lines to talk to us. Okay, that's unfair. Maybe they just thought we'd make good company, who knows. But they weren't "just being nice" because they were clearly using the tried-and-true lines used by playas and playa-wannabes alike. Appreciate the courage and gesture, fellas, but I have a man and so does Yuj.

I'd definitely come back to shoot some pool the next time I'm back in the area. If I lived up north, I'd definitely make this a place I come to at least once or twice a month just to see the nice people, drink some beers, and kick some ass. ;) But I have to admit ... I'd most likely catch a ride here with a friend or take a taxi because FINDING PARKING WAS RIDICULOUSLY HARD! This whole area is POPPIN' on weekends so I think we spent a good 30 minutes circling around looking for parking. Ugh.

But all in all, wonderful bar, and awesome pool hall. Lovely people of Kilowatt -- see you again soon! :)
author: Stace K.

description: This place was absolutely terrible. Walked in to watch the hockey game with my wife and immediately was taken back. It was evident that we weren't welcome and we sat right in front of the bartender and got not even an acknowledgement. There was a table of jerks really being nasty. Went to Giordano Bros and had an excellent time. We were the only two Lightning fans with roughly 20 Hawks fans but everyone had a great time. I'll spend my money where it's wanted. Hope your bar goes bankrupt.
author: Nate C.

description:
Decent beer selection. Plenty of space. 

Since there's a wait at the Monk's Kettle, get over it and hit up Kilowatt.
author: Marcus C.

description:
I felt old here LOL.  Drunk 20-year old somethings chatting me up while waiting for my beer.  Good times, brah.

Beer selection, excellent.  

And how can one not like the totally cheesy, retro neon sign out front?

Then Slayer came on the jukebox.  My buddy and I just looked at each other, nodded and smiled.

I love me a good dive bar; Kilowatt, I love you.
author: Chris B.

description:
Kilowatt can suck my taint. Full disclosure, this is based on my personal experience on a single night at this bar, but, regardless, it does not change my opinion that Kilowatt is one giant gooch licker.

I was there on a Saturday night and good God did I want to die from the sweat factor. But my excessive perspiration wasn't even the worst part. Kilowatt has two pool tables that take up a large part of their standing room. I'm all for playing a nice game of pool while I'm drinking but there was practically nowhere else to stand except within a foot of those pool tables. Every step I took, I immediately had to take another because each step landed me directly in the flight path of a different person. I felt like I was constantly in someone's crosshairs and I needed to move quickly lest I be shot. Better yet, I felt like I was playing that hot lava game that kids play where you have to constantly move your feet to avoid the lava melting your feet off. One extremely pleasant (*eye roll*) goth woman elbowed me because I momentarily placed my body in a spot she wanted to stand so that she could hit her cue ball. Look, I get it, you're trying to play pool and I'm in your way, but you have just witnessed me spend the last 20 minutes doing a constant 2-step all around the bar trying to get out of every single person's way. Give me a break.

The one upside, which turned out to be a double-edged sword, was that the drinks are stroooooong. My dude-bro friend ordered me a vodka cran for my good ol' b-day and I swear that drink was so close to being clear that you would have thought it was straight vodka with an inkling of a splash of something pink. Normally, this is a fantastic thing, but considering I wanted to get out of the Grundle Cave as quickly as possible, twas very hard to chug my very strong drink. Oh woe is me.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
Super reasonable prices on beer!  During happy hour (until 7 on Saturday) just about all the pints were $3.50.  They had several craft beer options, including Stone, Bear Republic, New Belgium.

Dog friendly.

No food, but you can bring food in.

TVs for sports.

Cash only, so get ready for that annoyance.
author: Leslie G.

description:
The pool-playing crowd was a bit uninclusive for my tastes. Kinda felt like the regulars were in control of things. Very hipster crowd.

I'd like to come back here on a not Sunday night and give it a better try. For now, I'll keep it in mind.

also, yay darts!
author: Conrad B.

description:
Well, this is a straight up dive bar with booths you can chill in.

The bartenders were nice and it's in a good location in the Mission.

They had some dark beer I really enjoyed but I forgot the name.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I love it here, the doorman on Fridays is super nice. The diverse seating arrangements are awesome, there's booths and tall tables behind the bar seating and what's awesome is that the noise level depends on where you're seated so you can go there for an intimate talk at a booth..or rage it out with cards,dominoes,beers, drinks...
As for the entertainment they offer they have 2 pool tables that are usually busy on Sundays during certain times they're $.50. There are also darts and a pinball machine in the back.. 
They have a great beer selection written out on a blackboard on the wall near the ceiling...you can see a lot of the taps though when at the bar...and so far the service has always been really good :)
author: Mar L.

description:
Kilowatt is awesome. Cheap, strong drinks, and a friendly bartender. OH and they have PAC MAN. 

I wish they had named it "Gigawatt" so I could actually have a reason to tell people we're at "1.21 GIGAWATTS?!?!" when they call me. Because that's what I say, and it doesn't make any sense. Hooray.
author: Emily D.

description:
favorite bar in the city hands down!! 

The bartenders are awesome, they don't remember my name yet but I take that as a personal challenge. Free pool on Sundays (shh don't come, we're busy playing), cash only, good beer and cider. AWESOME bloodymary's on Sundays too. Also, I like that I can get trashed, go to Deja Vu for some pizza and bring it back into the bar with no problems. 

love love love this place. douches, please don't come here. kthanks.
author: Kati Z.

description:
One of my very favorite bars in town.  All the bartenders are more than welcoming.  They even manage to remember my name and drink.  Excellent drink prices. 

Great place to watch a football game, shoot a game of pool or play darts.  Actually, this is one of the few places to play darts where the area is blocked off, preventing drunks from accidentally walking into the path of a flying dart. 

During daylight hours it is easy to find a seat and the clientele is laid back.  

It does have the typical problem of being filled with douches after 9pm though.  It seems every bar has that problem lately.
author: Towanda S.

description:
So many tattoos, so many beards! This place gets busy!
There's some pool tables and darts and a lot of onlookers for those games of skill. Didn't feel that clean here but the Mission's not supposed to be a clean place. My drink was okay.
Some people were crazy pumped up here. My favorite thing was the elevated area towards the back so you can look out onto the whole scene, very cool.
Cheers to the the guy with the dog tat who got me my vodka and tonic, you're a cool dude!
author: Lizzy M.

description:
I love Kilowatt.  Why?  Well, as a bar infamous for Packers fans, where else would you want to watch the 49ers beat the Packers?  The sadness is palpable by the end of the game.  That alone is awesome.  Especially during the playoff game in January, 2014, when one super drunk girl kept yelling at the screen and Skrillex the female was losing it and arguing with Niner fans.  Aside from enjoying watching the hopes and dreams of Packers fans get shattered, there are a variety of reasons I enjoy this place.  

1.  They let you bring in outside food.  If you are ordering drinks, they don't care, and given that the Mission has a killer selection of food, this makes it a great place to watch a game or hang out.  
2.  Darts AND pool.  Plus they throw a television up in that area for games.
3.  Televisions EVERYWHERE.  Nothing is worse than being stuck trying to find a screen you can squeeze your way closer to so you can see a game.
4.  They are the most dog friendly bar in the city.  Any Sunday, you are likely to find a variety of dogs hanging out, some meandering the place by themselves, all super friendly.  If you don't love that, you should ignore all of my reviews, because you have no soul.

It is cash only, but given how hectic sports bars can be during playoffs and such, that seems like a pretty solid policy.
author: Dick S.

description:
Inexpensive drinks, well made drinks, plenty of seating room, and dog friendly? Sounds like the type of bar I'd put myself in with friends!

Came here with some friends the other night, the place was starting to get packed (but still comfortable), we managed to grab drinks quickly, and found an entire hi-top table to sit at. Score!

I liked the decor, it was dimly lit, had a good dive bar feel, and people seemed friendly. They also have tv's all over and a dart board in the back that you can use for free, however you have to put a small deposit of $10 down if you would like to use it. Totally makes sense, considering I've been to other places that have busted darts and then it makes for crooked dart throwing, lol.  I would like to bring my dog in, but would avoid doing so on busy and weekend nights because it gets a bit packed later on. Also as an FYI, it's cash only, so hit up an ATM before you stop inside!
author: Akvile D.

description: This place has a ton of attractive 20 something year olds. So if you're one of them then you should be fine.
author: Andrew M.

description: Chill place. Always one of our stops when we go bar hoping in the mission. Can get really crowded on the weekends, but that's probably because of the free birthday bottle of champagne that they give out. Yay!! Free champagne!
author: Cassie M.

description:
I gots to give it up for the best pool spot in the Mish. 

Two tables, but two very nice tables for a bar. Too bad the tables attract the "I'm way better than you at pool" douche bags like flies to a pile of Oprah's shit (I assume flies like to eat expensive shit). Very common hang out for random dudes who stand around by themselves getting drunk, hitting on uninterested chicks, whooping ass at pool. Shout out to Evy for claiming lesbo status to shake that one guy off. He didn't really care though.

Besides the aforementioned douche baggery, it's got a good pool hall-ish vibe. People are generally pretty good without being phenomenal so you can still compete even if you are just OK. Roll through on a Fri/Sat though and your ass is gonna be watching for a long time before you're up.

Anytime I'm in this neck of the woods with a jonsin' for some pool, Kilowatt pops to mind first. That makes me a fan I'd say. The beer selection is on point too.
author: Justin N.

description: First  time here. Good vibe . N super chill. A little mad that i couldn't  have my service dog inside, kinda unfair ..that is all
author: Audrey R.

description: This is a dog friendly bar! Bartenders are nice. Drinks were cheap!! Went when it was slow and need to charge my phone. The bartender let us charge it behind the counter. Love it here!!
author: Christine M.

description:
DIVE BAR FOR PEOPLE ... AND DOGS.

came here with a few friends for SF Giants game #5. Despite the rowdy overpacked bar due to the festivities and excitement, it was such a great atmosphere. wasn't much to see as we were crammed to our tables in the back but TV was visible in all angle, good stuff. Bar serves was fast. Unfortunately NO FOOD but you can bring your own food in. Mission is food haven so all works well. 

The most intersting thing would be dogs. Dogs outside, dogs inside. I felt like "karma" was my own dog as she walked around the bar like a regular. This is a bit strange, but i love that about this place. 

OH and they server Pear Cider!!!!!!
author: Jane A.

description: What else should I say: it's a great dive bar in Mission. Good selection of beers, well-mixed drinks without being too fancy. Grab a beer and play some pool. That's what a bar should be like.
author: Sebastian F.

description: I'm from Washington state. They wouldn't let me in because they are ignorant of what licenses in other states look like and think if it doesn't look like a California license that it's fake. Please train your staff better.
author: Emma Z.

description: Gotta love a good dive bar with plenty of TVs for sports viewing, darts, pool, and tons of seating. We were actually very surprised with the size of the bar, huge on the inside! Cheap, great/friendly crowd, nice beer on tap. CASH ONLY. Definitely will return.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Things Kilowatt has going for it: good beer selection, cheap.

Things going against it: insanely loud, pounding, unappealing music, uncomfortably crowded despite being a large space.

I only went here once, so it's possible I just caught it on a bad night, but I really had no desire to go back again.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I'll try to keep it as short as possible.

SUPER CHEAP BOOZE.

Friendly staff/people.

Alcoholocaust.

I got destroyed.
author: Gene P.

description: Eclectic customers, with or with out pets.  Good choice of brews, friendly staff, pool, darts, games on TVs.  What more could be wanted
author: Mike S.

description:
I used to really like this place, but it seems that the magic has faded.

I came here on a rainy Saturday night to celebrate my birthday. It was packed, but the five of us managed to find a table near the back. The pool players were really aggressive and almost hit my friends in the head a few times. No one bothered to say sorry, even though we were tucked as far back as we could go. 

The male bartender kind of ignored us for a while, then made our drinks really weak. I drank a Long Island Iced Tea and barely felt anything, even though I have a low tolerance. If I pay $9 for a drink, I want it to wreck me a bit.

There was also this awful smell all night long, like rotting eggs. It was on and off, but when it was in the air, it was pretty rank. Maybe it was a gas leak? Or the sewer? Needless to say, we decided to bail early and head across the street to find another, less smelly, bar.
author: Brandi W.

description:
Its become my Niner bar. I've been here before on a regular bar night and I didn't even realize they had televisions!!! Then one Sunday I walked into Kilowatt looking for a bar not overflowing with Steeler's fans and saw that it had a bunch of dudes looking skyward 

Now...I love love love football. I also love love love dudes who love football. There is no better place to get a friendly mix of both on a Sunday. 

Bartenders are friendly and the crowds are quick to cheer but not arrogant fans, nor is there any drama between fans. I dig it. 

Cocktail of choice: On a Sunday - Bloody Mary - a nice spicy kick.
author: Jay H.

description:
While I appreciate the wall of dog photos and the apparent dog-friendliness of this bar, Billy Joel the Dog would never be seen here.

Here are some things I don't appreciate:

1. 2 massive pool tables in the middle of the bar.  Your bar is in the Mission, which has become a hot spot as of late.  Why would you waste valuable real estate in the center of the bar with pool tables?  Sure they are fun if you're in to pool, but pool is a 2 person game.  The other 98% of the people in your bar are crammed against walls because for some reason you are popular and you care more about pool players than the rest of your clientele.

2. Dart platform area- another HUGE waste of space.  Yes, darts are also fun.  But when you are in a location that leads to your bar often being packed (I've only been once, but it was a rainy Friday- I can't begin to imagine how crowded this place would be when it wasn't raining), you can waste this space for sharp objects.  Put some tables up here.  Much better use of space.
author: Nora S.

description: I've been on a streak of going to good bars in the Mission, and this one can definitely be added to the list.  Really roomy, great for happy hour, pinball, a pool table, and darts!  What more can you ask for.  Great place.
author: Mel G.

description:
This is one of my go-to bars in the Mission.
Why? Cause I remember the name (I suck at names)? Cause I remember the location? Cause it's the first bar I pass by once I get off the bus from my house?

Or maybe just because it's a chill bar, where you can watch the games, play pool, hang out and people watch. Oh and because I have good memories of this bar as I watched 2 Giants World Series (2010) games here. 

Drinks are cheap & strong. Bartenders are friendly if you are friendly.

Whatever reason, I like this bar.
author: Helen D.

description:
I guess there's a reason I don't go out so much anymore.  i am basically becoming an old man.  

We came on Friday around 11 and it was crazy crowded, to the point that there was really no where to stand.  We tried to stand near both the pool table and the darts, but the serious game players were not having it.  The bar wastes a ton of space on the 2 pool tables and big dart area.  

I left after about 30 min because I was feeling claustrophobic and annoyed.
author: Julia D.

description:
If you took a dive bar and gave it a bunch of Extenze pills to make it "bigger" then you'd get Kilowatt. 

Two or three beers on tap at a regular dive instantly enlarges to about 40 different brew choices here. The usually empty pool table at any other dive somehow has non-stop male on male action on it and I gotta put my name on a board that already has 7 people in front of me just to get to play?

A solid neighborhood bar that's well equipped to handle large and numerous groups. Our group of 5 was comfortable and the  refreshing pitcher of Mothership wit was ($14). And No, I'm not ashamed to say that. 

Man, I need to stop watching these late night infomercials. 3.5 stars.
author: Earl G.

description: Chill vibe but bartenders have some attitude. They don't really promote dancing like the rest of the bars in the area this is more just stand up and drink or talk. I'd come back for the vibe but that's about it
author: Alonzo T.

description:
Pool tables (more than 1), plenty of tables to sit at, good music, friendly faces and cheap strong drinks! Can't ask for anything more!  But it gets crowded on the weekends and the music is loud so it can be super hard to hold a conversation with your friends.

Parking bites but this is in the Mission so might as well think you'll have a 20% chance of finding parking here on a Friday or Saturday night beFore you get here and just take BART! Save yourself some gas, go green and save the world from excessive pollution (if you got one of them "older models" that's not a "green" vehicle)!
author: Mercy D.

description:
We walked into Kilowatt after leaving Zeitgeist full of cheeseburgers, nicely buzzed and seeking shelter from the cold wind. We were greeted with plenty of space and the cutest bull terrier I've ever seen. We picked a booth and ordered and ordered and ordered drinks to our heart's content. Meanwhile, my ears were treated to "Steppin' Stone" from Minor Threat and "Holiday in Cambodia." I'm digging this place like whoa.

As I walked to the bathroom I discovered two more of the cutest dogs ever (when I go on vacation, I become obsessed with strangers' dogs and fawn over them because I miss mine). Kate's, Golden Gate Park, Zeitgeist and now this place? This has to be the best day ever!

But wait, it gets better still - I discovered the jukebox was full of gems like old Cure and Maiden. I promptly played "Hallowed" to the delight of the entire bar. An hour or so in, we looked up to find the place was packed. And not only had we still not heard the brunt of our awesome songs, crap had been playing for the last 20 minutes. So we decided to head ...somewhere else where we wouldn't have seats but the music would be better. 

But Kilowatt was the perfect segue from Zeitgeist to Elbo Room. And our adventure continued.
author: Lauren V.

description:
This is most def a dive.  I have been here a few times and the best times are when I am in a larger group of friends.  There are lots of interesting characters of which most seem to be regulars because they know the bartenders.  I have had interesting conversations with complete strangers.  

They serve cider... so I am cool with that.  People tend to snub the poor cider. But it is so tasty!

The people that hang out here are pretty cool... calm... no issues type of crowd. I never feel like fights might break out or anything of the sort. 

It gets crowded and loud later at night, but that just means there are more people for you people watch... one of my favorite sports at bars. ;-)
author: Amelia M.

description: Busy! On a Friday night, it's fairly packed and people are not ashamed to push their way through. It's not super comfortable and part of our party left for the bar across the street. The pool tables in the back take up so much room, standing room is a little limited. The bartenders seemed nice but took a long time to get drinks out- they were probably really backed up. I feel like I've been to this bar in a Mission dive crawl before- but those details are foggy, the place does have a familiar feel to it.
author: Naomi K.

description:
pool tables, killer happy hour, great beer list, generally uncrowded on weeknights. TVs for sport or political things. cash only.

get a burrito nearby and chill in a booth.
author: Miranda E.

description:
I'm loving Kilowatt. I've been here in the evenings a sparodic number of times throughout the years, but recently it's become my favorite happy hour spot in The Mission.

Cheap beer, great cheap happy hour specials, laid back vibe. And Kilowatt has pool tables and games! Kilowatt is divey and laid back but not gross, fun without being suffocating. Come one, come all, drink all the beer you can handle.

After leaving here, I always feel a little more chill.
author: Denise B.

description:
To the best of my guesstimation, San Diego and San Francisco share sister communities. For instance:

San Francisco's Marina=San Diego's Pacific Beach. Nice surroundings, but tons of douche bags that hang/live there.

San Francisco's Lower Haight=San Diego's Ocean Beach. Ton's of hippies, though the Haight has much more history with the Grateful Dead and all....

San Francisco's Mission=San Diego's North Park. Hipsters galore and very few places that accept credit cards.

Even though I'm a bit frightened every time I step foot into any bar in the Mission, it's as close to my vibe as I'll ever find in the Bay Area. I'm a sucker for a dark, slightly dirty dive bar... and there's plenty of 'em between Potrero and The Castro. 

A telling sign that you're in a legit dive bar is the bathroom. If there's no toilet paper in the stall, you know you're in good hands. Just sayin'. You shouldn't be shittin' in a Mission dive anyway....

The one thing I always forget about is the lack of credit card swipers in this area of town. Personally, I think it's more progressive to have credit cards, as opposed to cash... but the community of bars in the Mission doesn't care what I think at all. If you don't have greenbacks, you're not getting a drink. It's just the way it is. And even though I never have money with me, I'm OK with it. In fact, there's a sign above the bar here that says:

"YOU'RE IN THE MISSION... CASH ONLY. ATM UP FRONT."

Even though I looked like a total kook because I didn't notice the sign until AFTER I asked if they accepted credit cards... I guess you can't get more direct than that.

For a dive, it's a big joint. I'd guess you could pack in 200+ people easily. There are a few pool tables, a few booths... and like most of the places in this neighborhood, dogs are welcome inside. I just wish the dog owners would put their pets through obedience school before they unleash them in an environment like a bar. There were some rough pups who really shouldn't have left the back yard... but what are you gonna do?
author: Ruggy J.

description:
"You're in the mission... cash only... ATM up front" reads the sign behind the long wooden bar.

My mind responded with the following: "You're just another hipster dive bar in the mission, get over yourself."

This would have been kind of a knee jerk reaction though, as the place really wasn't as pretentious as I was expecting it to be.  I rolled in with a couple of hooligan cohorts, the last of our bar-stops for the night, to grab some late night hooch and kick it.  The scene was dark, dog-friendly, and divey.  The prices were not all that cheap,  but I guess I'm in San Fran, so whatever. 

The tender immediately carded my friends and I, even though none of us look remotely near 21, which was kind of annoying, but again, whatever.  The beer selection is decent, the pac man machine looks well used, and a bike parked up on the mezzanine (and I use that term loosely) was amazingly NOT a fixie, so I guess that they do allow some normies inside.

Us normies enjoyed our Stone Pale Ales and a rousing game of travel pigmania as we helped to keep the two dogs in the bar from viciously attacking each other. It was somewhat surreal at moments.  

All in all, there really doesn't seem to be anything special about this place. it's kind of a shithole but it's not cheap. There's no real character. It's not all that divey. Again, whatever. 

3 stars, I guess.
author: Don B.

description: Cool dive bar. Stick with either beer or a simple drink like vodka/tonic.
author: Dilly M.

description:
Decent bar. 
Cool pool tables and dogs are allowed inside!! 
However, floors are terribly terribly sticky and the bar is always so packed that it makes me want to not get a drink. 
Good location, decent prices, nice beer selection (all around $5) 

Came here with a friend on her birthday, and the bartender gave us a bottle of champagne. How fun!
author: Taryn S.

description:
I don't remember the 1st time I was here.  One time I almost don't remember was here was with Rebekah T and Jaime H and some other people I can't remember offhand and apparently I purchased something with flashy colorful lights.  I do remember waking up at home and wondering what the hell it was and where I got it from.  I guess I talked that candy girls ear off before I bought this.

I remember waking up and thinking to myself, "How the hell did I get home and what the hell is that vibrator doing next to my bed!"  I was momentarily horrified at the prospect of what I had done until I made some frantic phone calls and the hazy memories started to come back.

When you turn it on and spin it by it's lanyard it makes pretty colorful patterns.

It now hangs from the front of my bass amp whenever I'm playing a show, cycling through it's different colors.  Thanks kilowatt!  Thanks candy girl!

This place has a great beer selection and alcohol, drink, blah blah blah.  Yeah just come here!  You're smart.  You can at least use a computer or smart phone and do a yelp search, you'll figure it out.  It's worth the visit.
author: Theron L.

description:
Kilowatt is -- without a doubt, my favorite bar in all of San Francisco. For those concerned with just the drinks, the beer is great and reasonably priced. An average beer is going to cost you around $5.50, and their selection consist of one some great German beers (most notably the franziskaner on tap). 

While beer is great, any bar can give you something cold and delicious. The real heart of Kilowatt rest in the billiards department. There are 2 nicely kept bar sized tables that at any point of the day or week will have people slugging it out. It is important to note that the locals that play pool here, which I'd guess makes for about 75% of the players, take their game very seriously. With that said, there are some really good players here that may lay the smack down on someone not so experienced. 

If you are looking for a place to play some competitive pool, Kilowatt is by far the best place to come. The great beer selection, homey dive feeling, rocking jukebox, and friendly locals are what will bring you back for more after you scratch on the 8.

Notes:
Happy hour typically ends at 7pm. 
Sunday is free pool all day.
author: Russell S.

description:
LOVE this bar. Good beer with pool and darts, what more do I need for a night out? Only thing a little annoying is that the pool regulars employ "bar rules" which apparently does not include teams. Pretty lame since everyone is trying to have a good time. 

Minus one star for the cash only.
author: Raina B.

description:
The aroma of musky beer drenched wood is strong with Kilowatt. As is the whiff of wet dog every once in a while. Or is that just a hippy? I can't tell.

Regardless, any place that allows dog lovers to bring their beloved for a happy pat on the head is A-OK with me. I love Kilowatt for 2 pool tables, pinball machine, dart board, and nominally priced beverages. The crowd is mixed with punk rockers to blazer doners and from my experience, quite friendly. The best thing is Kilowatt is quieter than your typical Mission fare. This is a fantastic place to unwind the night or enjoy a dive bar night out and is conveniently located to the infamous danger dog stand.
author: Jason C.

description: Decent drinks, service, ambience, etc. but I have to send a message to the staff for policing the juke box. We put a decent amount of money into the jukebox, queued up a range of stuff and heard none of it. Well, maybe 10 seconds of a few of them before they were skipped via remote by the bartenders. Instead what we got was a force feeding of something that sounded like dream theater taking a mastodon shit on Metallica. We get it. you're dudes who grow long hair, sat through a combined 30 hrs of tattoos, and are attempting to cultivate a pseudo cult classic metal look while surfing above the pop culture flood on top of your soap box. Meanwhile, your rent is paid by folks who just want to get some drinks and not take life so god damn serious for a few hours. Bottom line: don't have a jukebox if you're  just going to veto peoples choices. We can cut out the middle man and I can just pay an extra $5 for my beer.
author: Jason T.

description: There are some master pool players that take residency in this joint. Also a Ms. Pacman game near the darts on the platform. Playing some good garage rock when I was there, and plenty of sitting room. A good, easy going stop.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
Yeah, I can dig it! After a few rough starts years back the last few stops into Kilowatt have made up for it.

Even on the more crowded weekend nights, I've gotten great service from the folks behind the bar. There was one blonde bartender who was especially cool and remembered to come my way whenever my buddy and I needed a drink.

Since the inner Hessian is drawn to the dirty rocker "theme" I think Kilowatt will complete my trifecta of bars on this block of 16th Street which includes Dalva and Double Dutch.
author: Art O.

description:
This is my go-to bar for chillin in the Mission.  Great location and cheap drinks.  They always have some decent beers on tap and it never seems to get too crowded.   

Call it a dive bar if you will, I prefer calling it a dog bar.

I've seriously seen so many cool dogs here, and the walls have photos of dogs.  Dogs make any bar awesome.

One tip: I lost a bet with my friend and he had one of the bartenders make me "the worst drink in the world" which ended up being a gin and malibu.  It was horrendous, so don't order one of those.
author: Crandon J.

description: Damn this bar and their jukebox etiquette. I mean, the bar is ok, but the jukebox!! For serious. Don't come here and plan to listen to the tunes you want, I'll tell you that much. You will pay all the monies, and the bar will skip your songs. And instead play horrible 25 minute long metal epic jams. Ugh. Fundamentally, if you have a jukebox in your bar, which people pay money to play music- they should be entitled to choose and listen to the songs that are played. It's only logical. Instead, the crazy ass bartenders overtake the machine and play whatever the hell horrible music they want. What a waste.
author: Sarah G.

description:
We ended up here after our whole party wasn't able to get into Monk's Kettle because they were at capacity.

Kilowatt is awesome for large parties because the place is huge!  It could be a warehouse in respect to most places in the city... especially in the Mission.  More divey in comparison to Monk's Kettle, but I can definitely appreciate a good dive bar with the right elements in place!

The selection wasn't nearly as intriguing as Monk's Kettle, but definitely noteworthy.  I love me some beer and they had about 20 different taps with a good selection including pilsners, IPAs, stouts, and ciders.  I was excited to see they had Franziskaner and they recommended a Downtown Brown for me since I like dark beer.  It was OK, but not as full bodied as I prefer.

Place is SUPER loud with lots of sports fanatics catching up on the games.  Bartenders are really friendly and it was a good time overall.
author: Regina B.

description:
MOTHERSHIP WIT ON TAP and DOG PORTRAITS. Mothership Wit is one of my favorite easy-to-drink wheat beers, and they have it on tap here! I could drink this all day because it goes down so smooth and has a lot of strong flavor right up front. The bartender was friendly and fast so thumbs up. Don't forget to tip your bartender!

This a classic dive so don't mind the sticky floors or tables, but admire the dog portraits! The beer list is chalked up on the wall across the bar (thanks to a tip-off from a regular) so you can see what they have. Very reasonable prices ($4 per pint/$15 per pitcher) for GOOD beer.
author: Charles L.

description: Great dive bar! Darts? Yes, please! Plus, the drinks were relatively cheap too, which is a rarity in this city.
author: Audrey A.

description: I have been a 16th street drinker for many years and never popped in here until one day and was shocked.  The place is a lot bigger inside than it looks from the outside.  The beer selection is remarkable (Radeberger and Hoegaarden and Great White everytime) and ever so reasonably priced.  My biggest regret about the Kilowatt was not parking myself inside sooner.
author: Sin F.

description:
When I first walked up to Kilowatt, there was a huge dog standing in the doorway. I thought to myself "bouncers have dogs now?" Turns out that it's just a dog-friendly bar. They run around all over the place in there. 

Towards the entrance, you have an assortment of bikers and grungy looking people. The further you walk into the bar, the more hipster people get. Interesting assortment of people, which leads to an interesting assortment of dogs since everyone brings them. It's fun to watch the big pit-bull cross looking thing chase Paris Hilton's Chihuahua around the place. 

Getting a seat or a table is hard and if you do, hold on for dear life. You get the vultures standing next to you, just waiting for you to make a wrong move. The beer is cheap, which is nice. Pitchers go for around $18 and they have an fantastic selection of them. 

(Note: drinking Fransiskaner after Indian food makes the beer taste like Bananas). 

There are some weird people in there. Some guy in the women's bathroom was getting a little too excited watching my friend wash her hands. But all in all, interesting place.
author: Mariko F.

description:
a watering hole

weird people

fun people watching

cheap drinks

cash only

too many cougars and loser guys with neck tattoos

typical SF

is this a haiku?
author: Athena S.

description: DON'T COME HERE!!! It's filled with old grumpy men who will physically threaten you over whose turn it is at the pool table. How do I know? Because my friend was grabbed by the throat by a barfly named Sam for that very reason. And what did the bartender do about it? They threatened to kick out my friend because Sam was a 'local'. Last I recall that doesn't make it legal to put your hands on another person. Nothing special about this place to make it worthwhile.
author: Aida T.

description:
Finally, a bar friendly to the Montreal Canadiens! Invited by a co-worker who ran into some friendly hockey fans when there last time, we decided to check it out...and we were not disappointed. Multiple Habs fans showed up, some even wearing jerseys! By the time the game started, a fair sized group of people had shown up to watch the game.

The bar itself is very unpretentious, and had a very fine selection of beers that could be purchased by the pitcher. There were a multitude of LCD TVs available, though the one above the bar could be a little bigger ;)

I'd give it 5 stars but they wouldn't put the sound of the game on. The music selection was pretty good, and they have a couple of pool tables in the back. 

Note, the bar is very dog friendly, so aside from Hockey I also had the opportunity to watch this woman's chihuahua constantly rail another little dog...not the entertainment I was looking for.

One final point, they don't serve food and are very receptive of outsiders bringing their own food (as long as you buy drinks of course0.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Most pitchers of beer are $15 bucks all the time and the crowd is a mixture of Mission locals (the pool sharks & hipsters) and SF locals as well as some out of towners. It's a good place to hang out people watch, play pool (only if you're good because the guys who play here often are quite good), darts, meet new folks or chat with friends. Great spot to bring people visiting SF. Lots of beer choices on tap and reasonably priced. 

I do have to say that it would be great if they accepted credit cards, but their prices are fair so it's a fair trade all in all. Just make sure you have cash if you're going here otherwise you can use their ATM and pay the fee, which is the cost of a beer I rather pay for the beer.
author: M R.

description:
Tracey and I actually met here last JUL...

She'd kick my butt if I didn't give it a good rating.   lol

All kidding aside, this is a cool neighborhood bar.

Centrally located in the Mission with good beers.

TV's, dart board, and dog-friendly ('nuff said).
author: Francis M.

description:
I recently checked this place out during the day, and it holds up as a good bar, day or night. Fancy that. Beers, good amount of TVs, and there were no less than FOUR dogs chillin' in the bar with us on a Sunday afternoon. Cash only (boo).

As far as night visits, this is a good place for bar games. Pool, darts... I actually learned how to play darts here. Okay, I don't remember how to play darts so I guess I didn't learn so much as drunkenly threw darts at a board here. But fun was had by all (to the best of my recollection).
author: Jennifer B.

description: Best bar in the mission forsure. Love the atmosphere, bartenders and bouncers are super friendly and they make a bomb ass margarita for us tequila lovers :) Definitely go here if you want to have fun and be around good people.
author: Lauren B.

description: A fun dive bar that's not too divey, a Mission bar with the right amount of hipster, and a pool joint with a few tables plus darts (in case you do have to wait).  The extensive beer menu is welcomed even if a bit overwhelming for the decision challenged among us.  Always a fun time with a group or even just a few friends.  Bartenders are friendly too.  Just remember to bring cash!  Like most mission bars, this place will refuse your plastic.
author: Nakissa G.

description: This bar is about a kilowatt from 4 stars. I guess it just reminds me of every other bar. Nothing too fancy or spectacular about their drinks...a place where locals hang to catch up with their friends...and not too cramped.
author: Celia C.

description:
I love this place. When I want to go to a place and have a shot of whiskey and a beer and listen to better juke box music, Kilowatt it is. In the Mission but away from some of the crappier trendy spots. 

They have 2 pool tables, an upper area for darts and a few other seating arrangements through out the bar. If you want a real bar in the mission go to Kilowatt.
author: Kate D.

description:
Kilowatt is one of the more trustworthy places to have a Manhattan in the Mission.  Slightly watery, but far superior to some of the other dingy, hipster bars on 16th.  

But HOLY MOLY watch out for pool sticks and stilettos damaging much needed organs and bones.  Kilowatt can be QUITE packed on a Friday/Saturday....and once I get going, I have been known to lose control of my billards and walking skills.  

I should probably stick to flats or kitten heels when coming here....but then I just wouldn't be the sultry shiksa that I am:)
author: Joanna M.

description:
Kilowatt is another dark and dank bar in The Mission. That would seem just my style but for some reason I've never been too crazy about the place. There are a couple of pool tables but serious money players usually dominate them. Sometimes I've been there and the beer tasted off and some times it's fine which leads me to think they don't clean the lines often enough.

I guess the biggest reason this place isn't in my rotation is because it's just as easy to go to 500 club, Thieves Tavern, or even Dalva and I like those places much better.
author: Manny F.

description:
This bar is alright and is a pretty popular neighborhood bar so it obviously gets pretty crowded and cramped on the weekends.  It is also apparently dog friendly as there were at least two large friendly dogs just roaming around inside the entire night.  I'm cool with that, I love dogs. 

They do have a pretty good beer selection and for a good price, but the cleanliness of glasses they are served in can be questionable at times.  Some of the beers I had were served in glasses that didn't seem very clean.  I almost felt like Quentin Tarantino in the beginning of "Desperado" when he stops in a bar in Mexico asks for a beer and receives it in a dirty glass, asks the bar tender (Cheech Marin) for a cleaner glass, and then is told by the offended bar tender that it's the cleanest one they have.  Oh well, cheers!
author: Erich D.

description:
Hey yuppie, stop coming here and fucking it up.  If you don't want me to punch you in the jaw or spray you down with beer, then stay away.

If you are not a yuppie, then bring down the dog and watch some football.  This is the best punk rock sports bar in the universe.  Peter, you rule.
author: Lemmy C.

description:
Kilowatt reminds me of The Bitter End, Mission version. 

I am a fan of dive bars, it's part of my Midwestern heritage. One of the downsides of dive bars though, are the low ceilings and dank environment. Kilowatt surprises with open space and high ceilings. It makes the bar seem a lot larger than it really is. 

One of my favorite things about dive bars are the games. I like to drink competitively, meaning i like to drink while competing in things like darts, it keeps my attention better than conversation sometimes. The dart boards in the back are well lit and out of the way of the traffic so you don't risk impaling anyone.

Dive bars are also known for their cheap beer. Kilowatt does one further by offering a wide variety of cheap beer. Having franziskaner weiss beer on tap will always get you extra points in my book. It was 5 bucks.. my friends got bottles of Bud Light for 3. 

The atmosphere is relaxed and diverse, a wide variety of people.. all friendly and all enjoying themselves, I as well enjoyed the vibe. Just another thing about the Mission that I love!
author: Hailey P.

description: Deep, high-ceilened bar with 2 pool tables. Tons of dog pics on the wall (presumably customers') Very cool dive on a crowded strip. I'd come back
author: Michael M.

description:
I've been here before thought to myself what a wonder dive. it had all the fixings for a great place to go with friends and get a drink.

Walls covered in random crap? check
Good selection in beer? check
Awesome bartenders that look like twin brothers? check
Great rock and roll nostalgic jukebox? check

I had a good time and for the most part the people there friendly. I will be back.
author: Zachery H.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?  Kilowatt's laid back atmosphere, strong drinks, pool and darts, makes for a great place to hang out and throw back a few.

We came here as the first stop in a long Wednesday night.  Only draw back -- I NEVER carry cash.  It's something that I've had to get used to being in San Francisco so often these days.  The cute bartenders are helpful and I don't think any of us had to wait longer than a few seconds to get drinks at the busy bar.

The music wasn't bad, loud enough to hear and sing along, but no to the point where we had to yell to keep up a conversation.
author: Madison B.

description:
Of all the dive bars in the Mission, I think Kilowatt is my favorite. It's big and roomy inside, has a real long bar with lots of stools, booths and pool. The draft beer selection is comprehensive and quality and bartenders are always on top of it and friendly. Oh, and there always seems to be at least a couple dogs hanging out, too.

I also love Kilowatt's great specials - a daily happy hour with $2.50 pints, $2 wells and $8 pitchers until 7pm, and $1.75 a pint for one kind of draft beer every Monday. Too bad I've sworn to (at least try to) stop going out on school nights.
author: Kristina A.

description: I absolutely love this place! The alcohol is decently priced and they have an amazing selection of beers. It's cash only though so don't forget to hit up the ATM before you head over there. One time I ordered a boddingtons and the bartender said they didn't serve it. I then pointed to it on the drink list and she gave me one for free simply because she didn't see it before. Awesome! What more can I say?
author: Zohreh A.

description: I came here on a Friday night and it was packed. Three words: Loud, dark, and crowded. There isn't much space to sit or even hang out. The pool tables must be a draw, because I don't understand the inefficient use of space. It's not a bad place to just get a drink and hang out, but other than that, I don't see the appeal.
author: Phan H.
