description: Cheap beer, happy hour 4pm-7pm, avg beer is about $3.75, after happy hour it goes up about 75 cents.  Bartender is super cool.  Pool is 50 cents.  Darts are free. When there's a big game on (playoffs or 49ers) they cover the pool tables.
author: Nicholas M.

description:
Of all the bars that I visited in the Mission District, this one 'felt' the most comfortable. Like every other Mission District bar, they take cash only and have an ATM by the front door. Wide and roomy, Pool tables in back, lots of seating up front, and something I am not used to being from San Diego, there always seemed to be one or two stools open at the bar. Perfect place to grab a beer and groove to the excellent music. 

The open ambiance and cheerful but busy staff made a great first impression. But then I had to order something... Kilowatt has a zillion different beers advertised on the chalkboard across from the bar. But not all the stuff on the board is actually tapped. So don't get your heart set on the non-descript "Nut Brown", because they wont tell you which brewery its from, nor is it popular enough to be tapped on the weekends. I settled for Guinness, and was a little horrified at the pour and resulting head. 

Bottom line: These aren't beer people, but they do dive-bar-in-the-cool-mission-district very well. If you are looking for a pleasant standard quality place to bring your friends and aren't too particular about your drink, this is the place =)

Cons: 
- Didn't double pour the Guinness
- Stinky wet pee all over the bathroom floor and the toilets by 8:30pm.
- Patrons that look like they are fashion victims - might be a pro if i was out with just the girls as some of those guys were hot, but the jury is still out on this ;D

Pros:
- Plenty of TP in both bathrooms
- Dogs!!  =D you can bring your best friends of both species
- One of the bartenders looks like Reed Rothchild from Boogie nights =D
author: Irresistable U.

description: This bar is a long time favorite. The drinks are great and the prices are extremely decent for SF. The bar is dog friendly which is super cool. It's always packed but the crowd is great. If you are in the Mission area, check this bar out!
author: Laurie R.

description: Cheap drinks!  If I ever feel like hitting a bar for some cheap drinks - this is the go to!  No, it isn't fancy, but they have naughty photo hunt and the drinks are strong!  Bring your cash!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
What a cool place. 

Went here on a date. The guy I was with has actually been here a few times and warned about it being a little divey but for me, I love dive bars and this place was definitely right up my alley. 

The atmosphere is awesome. Totally chill, definitely have tons of seating, plus they have 2 dart boards and 2 pool tables. 

I have to say that I am impressed with the beer selection. They had Boont beer, which is amazing and for some reason really sparse in the city. They also had Big Daddy, but that one seems to be around the city a little more. I was more excited for Boont. The price is CHEAP too. I love paying under 4 bucks for awesome beer.

The only drawback is that it is a cash only bar. They do have an ATM in the bar, but I rarely carry cash. Other than that, go, check it out and have a blast. You are definitely in for a treat!
author: Diana R.

description:
Yo, not pretentious.  Good drinks.  Cheaper than your middle-class Mission hipster joint.  Big.  Pool table.  Pictures of dogs and motorcycles on the wall, go figure.  

And, an odd bit of 'who gives a sh^&', I was able to walk in during the Dyke March and use the bathroom.  It was easier than the lines post-movie at the theater.  Downright weird.  

This place just has good mojo.  I can't explain it.
author: M M.

description:
I stopped here last summer for a cold beer before heading back to the office from a jobsite. I found it to be a nice dark and quiet bar that you could just stop in for a pint without the regulars staring you down. 

I learned about Kilowatt beause they are an AFM sponsor. I had hoped to run in to my friend Cliff, who's neither white, obnoxious, or a mailman.  

Cheers!
author: Kevo M.

description:
Popped in here last night and wow, this place is timeless...it hasn't changed one bit.  Used to spend a lot of time shooting pool in here a few years ago and it almost felt a little strange stepping back.  Looked at all the pool shooters and it's definitely still shark-infested waters.  Saw some players with their own fancy cues (I have a bunch, but who brings a nice cue into a dive bar anyway...coin op cue balls are way too heavy...like a Buick...I save mine for friend's homes and pool halls)  The signup boards were both about seven or eight names deep...yikes.

Anyway, didn't get on the table this time, but might be back in the near future to play again.  Should be fun to see if anyone good is in there.  Happy to see that it's still dark inside here too...I've always loved the darkness.
author: Roy N.

description: Cool, spacious bar in the mission with lots of screens for sports. Sort of so-so on the inside and nothing special, but serves a purpose...and takes dogs!
author: Lauren C.

description:
I went here a few months ago and drank so much bourbon that I couldn't drink beer (although I did manage to spill it)... it was awesome. The time after that I drank the Stella deliciously. On one of these times, a homeless person rapped to us outside. 

They were both on weekdays and it wasn't too crowded or weirdly empty. The juke box gets the music on and the bartenders are cool. Actually the bartenders are especially cool because they are quick like magic.

They don't have any particularly good deals but there prices aren't horrible either.
author: Stephen S.

description:
So this place is still as crowded as the other times I've been here, but I had to drop a star on this spot because of what happened with the bartender when I first ordered a drink.

I don't know if it was because I was kinda all fancied out due to my attire of the previous spot I was at, but when I ordered my kettle one on the rocks and paid with a 20 gave me change as if I paid with a 10 and walked to the other side of the bar to help and immediately helped another patron.

When I moved over to the other side of the bar I had to wait for him to get to me even though I was trying to get his attention, when he finally got to me after helping two others he asked if I was sure, to which I had to insist that I did.  After a couple of going back and forth he finally gave me the correct change.  I still tipped the usual two dollars per drink that I do and walked away, but he seemed shocked that I still tipped him. 

Anyway, still a great place with great atmosphere, but you still lose a star.
author: Mark L.

description:
You have to respect Kilowatt for what it is...a dive bar.  Dive bar means:

- drunk pool games by somewhat homeless, bendover crack showing over 40 year old men.
- a tireless rotation of AC/DC, Metallica and one Justin Timberlake song in to be hip
- GREAT selection of beer on tap
- gum on the bottom of your bar stool

Thanks for keeping it real, Kilowatt!
author: Kamael S.

description: Awesome bar! There's pool tables and darts in the back. Fun place to hang out.
author: Ruthie S.

description: I've always felt the Kilowatt was one of the best dives in the city.
author: Kev M.

description:
About three years ago my dad was visiting SF and he wanted to watch our hometown team's football game that day.  I was happy to oblige since he's dad and I thought it could be fun.

I asked my roommate who likes sports where in the Mission he'd recommend to watch the NFL on a nice TV but not too sports bar like and he suggested the Kilowatt.

We had a good time and it was cool to do something with Dad that he was into.

Then something completely insane happened.  I got really into football later that year.  Like, I was into football when I was 8 or 9 years old, but eventually got into music and art and things like butoh and was just not like the football type anymore, or so I thought.  

I don't really know how it started, I think our team almost went to the Super Bowl that year, but it was crazy, I started showing up at 10am by myself to watch games.  My parents half seriously bought me a jersey for Christmas that year, and I half seriously started wearing it on Sunday mornings to root on my team.

Well, 3 years later, there is nothing half serious about it.  I am really into it.  I don't want to be one of those "closet jocks" in the art scene.   No, I am really into it.  I love watching football.  It's become kind of part of who I am.

And I love watching football at the Kilowatt; it's is a great pace to watch a game.  Basically it's a mix of people like me, or closet jocks or people who are just people or whatever you want to call them, but overall the meat head factor is decidedly low, which is awesome.  No one team's supporters dominates the overall crowd, so it's a varied scene on Sundays, which is nice.  There are even free hot dogs and coffee.  Like, cheap as free, dude!

The bartenders are cool.  I mean, I am a usual $2 a drink tipper, so the bartenders are usually cool, but like the guys/gals are cool cool.  All in all, I wonder to myself, would I have rekindled my childhood passion for heroes of the gridiron if it weren't for a place like the Kilowatt?  Perhaps not.

My experience of the Kilowatt, in a nutshell, is a positive one.  Oh, and I love the sign "CASH ONLY, You're in the Mission..."

Right on.
author: Ben V.

description:
When all else fails in the Mission, Kilowatt is always there for me. For that, I love you.

Your drinks are cheap and your games are awesome. Even the hipster crowd here seems more laid-back and tolerable than usual. I'd give you 5 stars if you would only take credit cards...

Also, Asian Antenna Man, I need to buy you a beer next time we cross paths, which shouldn't be too hard considering I see you every visit.
author: Leo K.

description:
5 stars for a dive bar is kinda crazy, I know.  But really, I can't think of anything bad to say about Kilowatt.  I've had a great time every night I've come here, whether it be for one drink or many.

Until midnight or so, the crowd is totally manageable-- to the point where you might be able to snag a booth until 10 or 11pm.  The beer selection (bottles and tap) is really stellar.  And the prices are absurd.  Nothing makes me happier than paying $4 for a really really good beer.  Seriously, everytime I do it I look at my partner and say "I love San Francisco" (compared to the $6 Bud Lights I was used to buying in NYC, its a really nice change).

And Kilowatt is a great reason to love San Francisco.  As they remind you by way of a sign behind the bar-- this is the Mission.  Cash only.
author: Kristin P.

description:
This bar may look a little rough around the edges at first glance but it's actually really cool. It quickly gets packed but people are generally friendly so it's not a big deal. Drink prices are fair and mixed drinks are poured well. 

I really love the darts and 2 pool tables that tempt both casual gamers to hardened regulars who bring thier own gear. 

It is odd that every time I'm in there, I run into a random friend who also doesn't frequent the place...
Check it out on a Friday and soak up some SF Mission culture.
author: Morgan A.

description:
Solid bar and just love the crowd here, It's indicative of the Mission crowd. 
They have TV's and a wide variety of alcohol so you won't be disappointed.
author: Eric A.

description:
Um, $3.50 pints of microbrew... HELL YES! 

The bartender was cute, nice and efficient-. kept us drinking without any major pauses- SCORE. I liked the selection of beer they had on tap- opting for the Mothership Wit with lemon, of course. The reserve bourbons they have available was quite pleasing for a Kentucky whiskey drinker like myself. LOVE the Woodford Reserve, neat. please. 

I was here on St Paddy's Day and there was plenty of space. I like that there is seating on the bar, in booths, at tables and the back area with the pool table and some arcade games. The juke box had a very interesting mix of songs that catered to the wide variety of peeps in the place. 

A super unpretentious place that made me feel at home with my geek glasses and hobo-beanie on. I definitely DIG this spot.
author: Nikki B.

description:
My friends came here sometimes but I'm always in no mood to go to the Mission, so one night I came straight here to watch a game (when the Phillies clinched their Division title). I know no one cares but it's a big deal for me :P
Anyways, I had a good time here, people were cool and the bartender & bar back were friendly. Oh, what's next?? Hit the pool tables when I'm here again!
author: Gabriele A.

description: Aside from the friendly bouncer, this place is typical of a crappy mission bar. The tattooed and self loathing bar tenders are happy to make you feel unwelcome and promise to give you terrible service--particularly the tattooed brunette who has a nasty habit of serving drinks after nibbling on a toothpick behind the bar. It's the type of place that you wanna tip a quarter for your drink.
author: Leon K.

description:
Slowly but surely becoming my favorite Mission bar.  Great beer, great vibe and much to my delight I found I can get my NHL fix here.  

I don't live in the hood (yet) but I love hanging out here.
author: Steven R.

description: Good beer, pool tables, cheap drinks. Pretty dark, but fun.
author: Carolina P.

description:
The vibe of this bar is pretty different and I must say refreshing.  We came here, lookin to score drinks and play some pool.  That we did.  But it's not that simple, there are things to discuss.

First, the scene.  

I saw the first mods I've seen in a long time.  Like, the mods in SLC punk:  skinny dudes with cute suites and ties.  I can dig it.  The two that I saw looked swanky, but confused and like they didn't really have any friends there.  Bummer. 

Next, the pool dudes.  Kind of like the dad's of everyone else there, ignoring their annoying drunk kids.  They take pool pretty seriously and are fucking good but are light hearted enough not to make you feel stupid.

Next, the brahs!  Definitely some brodudes chillin in their striped shirts with the sleeves rolled up.  They seem nice enough here.  

Not a lot of mission-core hipsters that I remember (I was pretty blitzed), which can be good or bad depending on what you like and/or who you want to hit on and hang out with.

Drinks are pretty standard price, lots of options on the jukebox, and high ceilings (I like this, I'm weird).  This is a cool bar.  Sorry for judging the patrons so hard, it's all out of love (and having fun people watching and analyzing).  Oh, I forgot about the Hawaiin birthday party.  WEIRD.
author: Brian G.

description:
50 cent pool games.  Pinball machines.  Dart boards.  Comfy chairs and booths.

HH M-F 4-7, Sat and Sun 1-7.

17 beers on tap.  Three different types of Hef.

Dog(s) wander around the bar almost every time I've been there.

Cash only, so come prepared.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Dude, this is the stereotypical big dive bar in the heart of the Mission. Everyone knows of this place and it's an institution in the Mission district of SF.

Drinks are cheap and poured strong, it's kind of dark and there are tons of TV with people yelling at them during whatever event is being shown. They showed the world series games a few weeks ago, and damn, the place are blowing up. Talk about insanity. Yep, it's that kind of place.

If you've never been, just go and check it out. Just don't try it on the weekend or any normal party day, as it'll be pack outside the door!
author: Erik B.

description:
As is the nature between girls, I recently showed my BFF a picture of a dude I was interested in. The exchange went a little something like this:

Devon: So here's the guy. What do you think?
BFF: He doesn't look like your type.
Devon: Huh? He's totally my type, I promise!*
Devon's Brain: Oh fuck, she doesn't think he's cute. Do I go with "He's just not really photogenic" or do I play up the "But he's got a great personality!" angle?
BFF: Oh no, I didn't mean it like that. I just mean he doesn't seem like a total metro or a pretentious douche.

Fair enough. It's a bit disconcerting when your future maid-of-honor can whittle down your type so unceremoniously but I can't really argue with her surmises. The girl has a point.

Kilowatt is like that gentleman...upon first glance, not my type at all. I like to dress up a bit to go out, and I like the other attendees to be sporting polos and designer jeans. And Kilowatt seems like every other psuedo-divey Mission bar. It's a little dingy and rough around the edges, and the patrons often look somewhat disheveled. The bar is big, but it's full of cranky pool players who growl at you when you try to go back to the bathroom. 

But it works.

It works because they have an excellent beer selection at affordable prices, and the bartenders are awesome at suggesting something new if you're burned out on the same old pint. And despite my criticisms of the crowd, the people are usually friendly and there have definitely been some striped shirt diamonds in the rough. 

It's one of the few bars in the Mission I actually ENJOY going to. In a way, because it's so wrong, it's so right.

*It turns out I was correct and he was my type in that after our first date he faded off into oblivion. While you wonder if my abandonment issues are real or staged, I'm gonna head over to Kilowatt, enjoy a pint of Downtown Brown, and hope that my view of the place isn't clouded by an angry pool player shiving me with his cue.
author: Devon S.

description: Great beer selections.  Minus the blarring loud music that was requested by a bar patron. The nice bartender was so accommodating but she could barely hear incoming orders.
author: L T.

description:
As I'm more of a dive-bar kinda gal, I like this spot a lot.

Good prices, good bartenders, pool if you like that kinda thing.

Sometimes sports on the TVs if you like that kinda thing.

Tables, booths, and usually some good punk choons.

The ladies room sucks, which is par for the course in dives.

But they've got plenty of cheap PBRs and whiskey shots, so that's okay with me.

Its becoming our wednesday night ritual, the drinking club at Kilowatt.
author: Roachie D.

description: Tons of beer, pool tables and a short walk from Little Star....
author: Alita M.

description:
ive been coming to this bar for quite some time, drinks are relatively cheap and strong and a great beer selection, along with zeitgeist, gesthalt, and dellirium (a spell check is needed haha), my fav. bar in the upper inner mission area

my friend and i love coming to this bar b/c
1) we feel like ppl here are always down to talk to each other, ez for us singles to mingle, knowaimsayin??

2) we love that mrs. pacman game in the back, we always play it, try to beat each other's score and a loser either has to buy a drink or does a dare (like hitting up on a group of girls or something like that haha) and we are getting proficiently good at it!

ahhh those dots....TO CATCH THEM IS MY REAL TEST, TO EAT THEM IS MY CAUSE, GOTTA CATCH EM ALL!!

overall i always end up having a good time here, thumbs up

4 stars
author: Michael K.

description:
I like this bar, not so much on a friday or saturday, too crowded for me.
Went here on a sunday, it was perfect, not too many people, friendly bartender and drunk friends.
I loved checking out the not so hot pool player with a weird head and fake boobs.
I wish she would be there every sunday.

Anyway, this is a nice spot with two pool tables and airy atmosphere.

See you soon.
author: cecilia k.

description:
Now this is a true San Francisco dive bar. It's grungy and grimey and drinks are cheap ($5.50 for a Bulleit bourbon rocks). It's a huge bar so plenty of room however in the back three pool tables take up a lot of space. It's actually not a bad place to watch sports as they have tv's everywhere. They also have darts and pinball so plenty of activities to keep you busy. 

This place falls right on the 16th St Mission bar/club scene so if you're bored there's plenty of other options to choose from.
author: David C.

description: I came here after one of the 49er games and the bar was probably moderately full. I am giving this place a 1 star review because I sat at the bar like 20 minutes and nobody asked if I wanted anything to drink so I just left. I don't know if it was just the day but it was like the people here were ignoring me they weren't even that busy. I will say the people I talked to were pretty friendly though that were drinking here.
author: Nicholas A.

description:
Wow.  First time there recently.  After work on a Friday.  Not too crowded.  Room at the bar, pub tables, and booths, too.  That was a nice touch.

So I see Guinness on tap.  We may have something here.  Then I see the Power's whiskey and I'm thinking "we have a winner!"

Now all I have to do is get some darts.  Two boards in the back, with proper lighting and accommodation.

The bar staff and other folks we met were friendly, too.  Looking forward to stopping in more often.
author: Ken B.

description:
Thanks to my fellow Yelpers who directed me to this bar when I was in need of a place to watch a hockey game.  Since I don't live in the area, I was relying solely on the reviews here and Kilowatt's website for general information.  However, I'd like to warn people that the bar hours posted on their website differ from the ones that they operate by.  We planned to arrive here when their website said they opened, but ended up having to wait an hour and a half at another bar (which we ended up preferring) before Kilowatt actually opened.

Ready to put that minor misunderstanding behind me, we sat at the bar ready to enjoy some beers.  I had no complaints about the quality of the beer or their selection, which was average for the Mission, but the bartender/bar patrons were generally rude and unwelcoming.  I don't need a big hug and smooch when I walk in, but I also don't appreciate when the bartender acts annoyed when I ask two questions, or when a fellow drunk/hockey fan steals at seat at the bar which is most obviously being used.
author: Megan B.

description:
Kilowatt is usually the place I'd go to after I've already been to a couple of other bars. This place is a little bit bigger than most bars and has more lighting.. so you don't end up feeling too wasted hah!

I always order long islands here, they're pretty good. But my favorite memory of this place is coming here to relax with my friends after having to scream at each other over the loud music at other bars. Beware, this place will get you in trouble. Every time I've been here I've ended up in a hot mess.

I lost my glasses outside the bar three years ago... I wonder if anyone ever found them? hah..
author: Debbie P.

description: Hands down, my favorite bar in the city. It's in a prime location in the Mission so it's perfect for a pre-dinner drink or as part of a bar crawl - always the first place I think of. The happy hour prices are some of the best I have found. The bartenders are super nice and never skimp on the alcohol. Good for a big group, even when crowded.
author: Brittany L.

description:
If you can stay away on a Saturday night, it's pretty great. Cheap beers, quick serviec and good atmosphere.

Saturday night, no movey. You can get a drink pretty quick but don't expect to move more than an inch to the right or left. Claustrophobes beware!!!
author: Erica E.

description: great happy hour prices, cash only. it's a dive bar so you should know what to expect,  but yes it's a tad dark and the chairs aren't very comfortable but if you like your beer strong and cheap and before 7pm you should check out kilowatt.
author: Misha T.

description:
So, I recently went to Safeway to purchase some wine. I have my I.D. at the ready, because you know Safeway pretty much always cards anyone who looks remotely like they are under 40. Well, the checker looks me up and down, and DOES NOT CARD ME. Omigawd, my worst nightmare come true. I'm only 26 - do I really look that old now??

Thank god for the Kilowatt bartender who asked to see my I.D. Bless your sweet heart. That was pretty much the highlight of my time here. 

Otherwise, Kilowatt is OK. I've spent two evenings here (one on a Saturday, one on a Wednesday), and I'm still not in lurrrrrve with it. I'm not quite sure why. Maybe it's because, as my fabulous friend put it, "Everyone looks so busted in here." Or, maybe it's because we put our name down to play pool, and the stupid guys in there kept trying to put us off from playing our game. When I put up a fight, their excuse was "You have to understand, we play legit pool here." Well what the hell kind of pool do I want to play dumb ass? All was well when we finally played them and took their "legit pool" skills and shoved it where the sun don't shine.

5 stars for Marty though!!!
author: Ava S.

description:
A good friend of mine got kicked out of here years ago, and I think it inappropriately biased me against the bar.  In defense of Kilowatt, my friends was utterly drunk off his ass, and probably deserved to be tossed.

The first great thing that happened last Friday night at Kilowatt was that I dropped a five in the juke box, and after punching in some numbers, still had 58 credits.  And this isn't one of those irritating MP3/internet boxes where any given song can cost anywhere from one to four credits.  Nope - this juke box has good old fashioned CDs in it: one credit = one song.  So I programmed in about 20 songs and passed the torch to a tablemate, who punched in 20 more and passed the torch again.

The point of all this, aside from all the awesome free credits, is that any bar is better when you can pick the music . . . ALL NIGHT LONG!

Add to that, nice divey vibe, unpretentious crowd, dogs, two pool tables, and nice cheap strong drinks . . . did Kilowatt once oust one of my friends?  I seem to have forgotten.
author: Joe C.

description: Awesome music, awesome beer, awesome patrons. The "P-Rock" in my name exists because of (or perhaps for) places like this.
author: Natalye R.

description:
It's an "A-OK" place to go for a beer or drink. Lots of seating for groups, dark corners for making out, a juke box that is cheap (just like Joe C.), pool tables and two semi-decent ladies stalls.

I had fun here despite that my first 2 drinks took me 10 minutes to order each (when the bartender was helping no one else). The rest of my drinks, I have no idea how long it took because some hottie was getting them for me. (thank you!) Rachel F. is teaching me to accept free drinks and not feel bad. **repeats new mantra: I will be Samantha, I will not be Carrie. I will be Samantha, I will not be Carrie.** 

All in all an A-OK experience and I will easily come back.
author: Ali R.

description:
This is usually the last choice when I meet up with people in the Mission, but overall, it's solid. It's not classy, it's not fancy. It's a useful bar that serves good beers and strong cocktails, has a pool table, solid wood booths, and has a good jukebox.

The location can't be beat, two blocks from BART, along the 16th St. corridor.

Ladies, this place is crawling with men at happy hour. It may take you awhile to get a drink on a busy night, but that's all right, there are plenty of men on the take in there that you can entertain yourself with.
author: Rachel F.

description: So, I bought two drinks and tipped a dollar. The dough faced attitude-y bar wench said to me "wow, big spender!" At that point I offered a five dollar bill for her to make change for a more "appropriate tip," but she protested. "No, it's ok.." she said, but I protested in response. "Obviously it isn't ok." I responded. To that she walked away... So fuck her and fuck this bar. I'm sure she's an artist or musician whose career is about to take off. But guess what? I don't give a shit. Sling drinks, lady... And be happy about the change you make.
author: Josh L.

description:
Kilowatt is nothing like it was back in the good old days of underage drinking and cruising for boys who looked like trouble. For starters, even I got carded here recently, so I'm pretty sure they're no longer letting in 17 year old jailbait with an attraction for all things scruffy. That's ok- I'm legal. Next up is the clientele. Gone are the bikers, bike messengers, leather lesbians, and garden variety punk rock slackers who used to be frequent fliers. Nope- now Kilowatt is kind of like every other bar in the Mission: 50% hipsters, 30% striped shirts and the ladies who love them, and 20% other (mostly comprised of B&Ters, the odd gay guy who got lost on his way to The Stud, and a tourist or two). 

Whatever. It's still a bar and they still serve booze and I didn't feel compelled to start a bar fight or spill a drink on anyone or make catty remarks with my nasty girlfriends. Kilowatt is packed on weekend nights, making efficient navigation of the bar impossible. You will lose your friends, you will spill your drink, and you may be knocked around a little in the process. But you'll find your people, there's more booze at the bar, and some of the people you are forced to rub up against will not be bad looking. I would 4-star them for the experience and the memories combined, but I have to take off one star for the overflowing toilets in the ladies' room.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Kilowatt is slowly becoming my neighborhood bar of choice... the laid back vibe, cheap drinks, great beer selection and rustic ambiance just have a way of making you feel at home. I can't think of anyone who wouldn't be comfortable in here. 

The first time I stepped foot in Kilowatt, Drue C and I were sneaking in to use the potty from the yelp elite event down the street at Double Dutch. On the floor of the bathroom stall was a little balled up pair of panties. We got a huge kick out of that and while we decided I could not review the place until I had been back for a proper drink or three, it was a hilariously funny first impression.

Avoiding the weekend scene here? That would go without saying...
author: margot b.

description:
I'm a sucker for any bar that allows dogs - I'm more of a cat person, but anything cute and furry on four legs will get my attention.  Oh yes it will!  Aw, yesh, it will won't it!?  Aw, yesh, you're such a good oh yesh, such a good boy, such a good boy!!!

Ahem.  Anyway, luckily I didn't do that while I was at Kilowatt (well, maybe a little), but it definitely gave me a good impression of the place.  It's a good sized bar, fair amount of seating and a couple of pool tables which I noticed are free on Sunday afternoons (or something like that - I think the regular price is $0.50 per game or so).  The drinks can be pretty strong too, also a plus - I think I paid $5 for my bourbon and coke.  Decent beer selection too, and there's a little table outside for those of us who like to ruin our lungs on a regular basis.

By the time we left it was getting pretty crowded, but I didn't feel claustrophobic at all, mainly because of the seating arrangements and the high ceilings.

Check out the walls, there's all sorts of interesting stuff hanging up there to keep you thoroughly entertained if you're in need of a distraction for any reason (luckily I didn't that night, but you never know for next time).

Another reason I need to get out to the Mission more often.
author: Sus... B.

description:
What to say about Kilowatt?  It was one of my first Mission Dive bar experiences and it's a true gem.  Between Pool and the associated traditions unique to Kilowatt, pinball, and being dog friendly it's a great spot.  Bartenders are pretty fast and efficient but also manage to be friendly.

Prices seem just a touch high for what you get but are nowhere near unreasonable.  And, like everything else in the Mission they are Cash only.

So what makes it stand out?  Mostly space, you can move around, stand and mingle, or plop down in a quiet corner at a nice booth.
author: David K.

description: Great place for happy hour and usually you can find a spot to sit.  Kilowatt has the added bonus of Hop Rod Rye on tap, but beware, if you order a pitcher, it's strong.  Try standing up between pints to get a grip on your perfectly divey surroundings.
author: Michael M.

description: I may be slightly biased but my boyfriend and I love this bar. First date was here and we have gone here twice since. We love playing darts, pinball, and pool. And they allow dogs. I love a good dive bar with cheap drinks. This is a great one. Really close to the Bart station too.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Some things have changed at the Kilowatt; To start with, they appear to have a sober, competent door guy now who checks IDs carefully. Also, gone are 90% the bikers and lesbians, replaced by an odd mix of yuppies, mission hipsters, and generally ordinary folks. It's still an acceptable place for a bottle of beer on a saturday night.

A bottle, specifically, because 1.) You'll have to shove your way through the unwashed masses to get from the bar to your table, and you're gonna spill the first 10% of that pint glass for sure, 2.) I saw them taking new glassware out of the box and putting it on the shelf without rinsing it, and 3.) Pacifico is a buck seventy five for a bottle.
author: matthew r.

description:
A dive/sportsbar in the Mission whose name suggests a level of electricity? Hmrph. They do have electricity in the bar, hence the lights, jukebox, and ability to keep things cold. The vibe? Not bad at all, but more 'eclectic' than 'electric'.

I like the fact they have a long bar, tall tables & chairs, and booths. The place boasts multiple pool tables, dartboards & a good jukebox as well. 

The walls host various black & white photographs from past shows (?) with various local bands. I will forever be in love with black & white photography, and am also a huge supporter of local music...so major points to Kilowatt on that end.

An out-of-town friend and I walked/chatted clear across town to the Mission, and this was the first bar at 10pm on a Saturday night which wasn't obscenely crowded. So...I guess take that for what it's worth as well. 

Reasonable prices. Stiff Drinks. 

The bartenders are hit & miss. I have been there before when they were more focused on getting drunk themselves and gave poor service...this past weekend they were all about helping and chatting up my date and myself.

I'll be back, when all else fails.

And on a final note, don't decide to walk around the city all night after riding 60 miles on a bicycle just hours before. Stupid f****ng idea.
author: matt m.

description:
C and I used to come here because it was one of the few Mission bars that allows dogs. We ran with the night here, unless it was a weekend of course, bridge and tunnel folks with whom we do not associate. 

With his faithful border collie camped under his chair, we'd throw back a few strong ones, shoot some rounds of pool, and go outside to smoke. It was one of places to bear witness to the crumbling of our relationship as our lives disintegrated. He had tears in his eyes and I could tell it was over.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
This is your typical Mission bar.  It's not fancy, can be a bit stinky, has lots of pictures of dogs on the wall.  They have a nice beer selection and have reasonably priced pitchers.  Good, stiff and cheap drinks...just don't ask for a mojito.

Right across the street from the bacon wrapped hot dog cart!
author: Luis M.

description:
I used to come to this joint all the time, especially back in the day when it was called "Firehouse 7", and they had live bands. More recently, I haven't had much cause to make the trek to come here. However, on a recent nite off from Mezzanine, I was out on the town, attempting to track down my ex-girlfriend to maybe hang out.

That never happened. 

However, I did run into one of my Mezzanine co-workers, and her very cute friend. So, rather than head over to see Blue Cheer at the Red Devil at my lawyer's invitation, I hung out and grabbed a very cheap beer (yay!) from the bar, which got to me very quickly despite the huge crowd celebrating a birthday. Cool.

But there were so many people (due to said B-day), we got seperated, and I couldn't even reach the table they were at. So, I decided to kill some time by shooting a little pool, which my regular readers know is one of my fave pastimes.

I eventually was matched up with a cute young lady, who won the previous game. she seemed to be a decent player, but I was feeling good, and thought I'd be able to win in short order.

Nope.

I started strong, with several nice shots to open the game, and had a 3 or 4 ball advantage. Then I missed one. She, apparently realizing that this was an actual game, suddenly came alive and starting knocking them in. Even when she finally missed one, I had no shots and wasn't able to finish her off. She proceeded to make a couple difficult--albeit makeable--shots, including a couple tough cuts to leave me with 2 or 3 balls still on the table.

[sigh]

That being said, I had to admire her sudden skill, so we exchanged pleasantries, but she had to go to do an early meeting at work. So, off she went into the nite.

When I sought out my friend from work, she too was gone, along with her hot pal. Damn!

To top it off, I was too late to catch Blue Cheer. Arrgh.

So, I went back to my 'hood, and drowned my sorrows at Buckshot.
author: ACE A.

description:
Dull bulbs. Normally would enjoy such lighting in a dive bar and have in fact in this very same one, as it's a scant three blocks away; watched the Democratic primary here, played pool here often and encountered many an agreeable sort (I especially like the regular who has the antennae). But two burnt-out halfwatts can ruin it for a local sometimes. 

Not a great place to pickup - partially to its credit - and the quality of bar tending seems to be wildly bipolar - again, a trait not unshared by its location and general Mission population. Much credit to the lady bartender with dirty blonde hair (at least it is to me in the lighting) and tattoos along her arms as someone I find quite agreeable because I think she laughed pleasantly at a barrage of tongue-in-cheek pickup lines my friend used on her some years ago. 

But this past Thursday night was damn near unforgivable as far as my continued patronage is concerned. Playing pool with a dear friend and his lady Samantha when, following a very understandable practice, one of the staff cleared their unattended drinks from the table. They said as much and were properly, albeit begrudgingly, given new ones. 

What happened next was beyond silly for people working at a dive bar in the Mission, but I sense Kilowatt is falling off in the way that a business that's been in one place too long, doing the same thing too long, and possibly the owner, but definitely some of the staff are probably pretty tired of it and such an environment, maybe life - and so they lash out. 

The staffer who brought the replacement drinks snidely reproached Samantha for leaving drinks unattended. And would you believe it, she gave him a haughty reply implying her innocence and his negligence. 

He retaliated! "Your drink was warm, what do you expect?" "It was half full and I'd just set it down, are you kidding me?" Despite verbal indications of optimism (I thought the glass half-empty), Samantha did not foresee shared ground with said disgruntled staffer. 

And then my friend took his girl's point of view up with one of the lady bartenders - who then proceeded to come over verbally joust, yell even, with her inebriated, upset, and now thoroughly crossed clientele, insulting and lecturing from her faux grunge pedestal.

What shite. Bring some joy and personality back into that place please, learn how to mollify mildly upset and drunk customers who are far from rabble-rousers even if they're not entirely in the right, instead of setting them off. Or provide a listless turnstile for fickle drinkers who'll happily slop down a few in a soulless dump because they know they'll never return.
author: Max F.

description:
Wednesday: January 3, 2006
7:30pm - 11:35pm

After Luis M. and I filled our bellies with sushi, we walked down 16th Street to start our quest for alcohol.  Delirium would have been my first choice, but neither of us has gone to Kilowatt before so we agreed to get a couple of drinks there.  

It was pretty empty.  There were a couple people at the bar, some playing pool and a few just chilling out outside smoking.  The crowd did pick up a bit at around 9pm, but died down after half an hour or so.  There are two pool tables, two dart boards, two pinball machines (one Terminator) and plenty of space to stand/sit for people watching.  Bathroom was surprisingly clean, but I did ended up with a few bruises on my leg because of this weird structure just outside one of the stalls that I would always bump into.  Oh, I almost forgot.  They allow dogs -- this bar is very dog friendly (framed pictures of doggies on the walls).  As long as the dogs don't come near me, I'm fine.  I was a bit bothered by the wet dog smell though.  

The bartenders are pretty nice, though the first guy (who's shift ended at 8pm), gave me a dirty look when I asked for a mojito.  The bartender who took over was awesome -- I liked her.  She was on top of things, very energetic and always made sure that we didn't have an empty glass in front of us.  I settled for Anchor Steam/Hoegaarden on tap and rum-coke for Luis.  

At the end of the night (11:35p)...  the alcohol + water count was as follows:
Luis M. = 6 rum and coke + 2 glasses of water
Celeste L. = 2 Anchor Steam + 3 Hoegaarden + 2 glasses of water

Guy #2 met up with us at the bar, so Luis got to meet him before he headed out to catch the BART train home.  We left Kilowatt not long after Luis did and headed out to Delirium for some Coronas.   Will probably go back to Kilowatt again, but I doubt Guy #2 will come along -- he wanted to get out as soon as he got inside. 

Celeste L.'s alcohol + water count total after 11:30pm:
2 Anchor Steam + 3 Hoegaarden + 2 Corona + 2 glasses of water :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
This could have been just another average bar if it weren't for three things:

1) The Nudey Game a.k.a. Erotic Photo Hunt (Best Game EVER!  If you have never played you better get your ass over here--or one of the many bars in the city with this game--you will not be disappointed, I promise...Also just a tip: always choose the 2 person game even if you are playing with a group of people, you get more chances this way)

2) The Jukebox-which played pretty much every song from the Rock Band video game which meant awesome music and a chance to practice my vocals for my next worldwide tour with Eric and the Eskimos (my current jam is "Suffragette City"...David Bowie is sexy)

3) $2 special on Sam Adams the night we went

For these three reasons I will definitely be going back to Kilowatt some time soon...you can find me at the end of the bar, dominating the Nudey Game.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Kilowatt has a more authentic dive-bar feel than most of the wanna-be dive bars in the Mission.  Maybe it's all the dogs, or the TV's all showing SportsCenter, or all the leather jackets, or the smell of bleach that you can't help but wonder if they had to clean up some blood last night or what.  But there's still a pretty chill atmosphere here.  Not TOO chill, but mellow enough, a nice, "stick to the business of drinking with your friends" vibe that is sometimes just perfect.

It's a big and high ceilinged place, which is kinda nice--still seedy but not quite so dank.  We're almost always able to score a booth up front, provided we lurk in wait for awhile.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Used to be a favorite, now it's just a memory of what used to turn me on about San Francisco: Hot, young, grungy skaters; pool tables; lots of beer drinkers; great music.  Actually, come to think of it, those things still turn me on, it's just that now, I know how to find them without going to Kilowatt.  So yeah, an old fave always, always have fun here.

Now - I understand the whole house rules with pool, because I'm the first person to call their own slop shots.  However, the doubles rule should be reconsidered.  Maybe just one table devoted to doubles when warranted?  I personally like playing singles better than doubles myself, but just to keep things moving, keep people content. . . ??

Dare I mention the free pool here every Sunday, all day?  What the hell!
author: Kelly H.

description:
I can't believe how many times I have been to this place without having yet reviewed it. 

This is one of my favorite Mission bars but probably because I tend not to come here on a Friday or Saturday night. 

Pool tables, dart boards, the memories of live music, reasonably priced beer, good eclectic juke box and -  very suprisingly -  no shameful stories out of this place yet. 

I know, I know...how is no shameful stories a good thing when we are talking about drinking??? I figure there has to be one place in town that I remain well behaved at, and this one seems to be it...Im holding on to that as long as I can!
author: Drue C.

description:
Drinks are cheap, bar tenders are nice, pool and darts.

You can bring your dog, people are friendly here.  It's a huge place on top of all that.  But Friday, and Saturday are pretty packed.

It's my favorite chill place in the area.

The only thing is that my friends sometimes like to dance, and in that case we'd prefer somewhere that play music like double dutch or skylark
author: Anthonio C.

description:
We wandered in from off the street looking for a beer and a chat. Since we hadn't been to this bar before we paused, looking up at the menu, curious at the selection. Let me tell you they had much to choose from!

I overheard what seemed to be a regular "they have never been to a bar before, look at them, haha." I guess I looked fresh faced and young that night. Thank you :)

The bar was semi-crowded and we were forced to the back near a very popular pin-ball machine. I enjoyed "The king" who was in a bean. For some reason this was hilarious to me because it stood out in all its tackiness and I kept looking at it out of the corner of my eye. 

Overall, great selection and fast bartender who was happy to serve us right away, even in the crowds.
author: Natalie N.

description:
This place has a lot of potential. It looks like a cool little pool hall in the Mission with a chalk board full of beers names on the wall. This is also very close to Valencia on 16th, steps away from BART. Nice Nice Nice location. 

The problem is that I don't get the feeling that this place really cares about beer. They have a few decent ones on tap. They had Stone Pale Ale, SpeakEasy Big Daddv IPA, Anchor Steam Christmas, and Sierra Nevada Celebration. (like I said, decent). Do not ask for a recommendation here. You will get a blank look and a guess. 

After enjoying a big daddy IPA, I decided to fall back on a good old Stone Pale Ale. I am quite sure that is not what I received even though I saw them pull the correct tap. Having been in this situation before and knowing the only way to prove it is to follow the lines in the back room with them and show them. I don't think they are trying to rip anybody off but instead just don't know. The beer I ended up tasted a lot like newcastle. It was not hoppy at all but instead it was sour in the finish. 

To be fair, this place seems like a nice pool hall and for that I am sure it is awesome. If you are looking for a beer bar there are a number of better options in the area.
author: Eric G.

description:
This is the first bar I ever came to in San Francisco. I had walked 3 miles, almost passed out from a lack of sugar, had a huge burrito and was then ready to drink. They had football on the tv, good drinks, a pool table and dogs running around. I was in love. 

If you come on a week night, their happy hour is also awesome.

I really enjoy this bar because it is long enough that when someone walks in, all eyes aren't on them. Go in the bar, find your niche and do your thing and forget the rest of the world exists. That's why we drink, right?
author: Jared S.

description:
I love this bar.  It's like 3 blocks away from my house.  Why don't I come here more?  Oh yes, trying to save money and not go out as much.

That's pretty lame. 

One of the first bars I went to when moving here.  It was my roommates favorite, and luckily we both have similar tastes in bars.  Probably playing some metal - might get a chance at the pool table.  Wide selection of beers for different price ranges.

I miss you, Kilowatt!  I will be back soon!
author: Kristina K.

description:
fun times. Went here on a thursday night, and was pleasantly surprised. not overly crowded, but a good mix of people. hard to go wrong with the music + cheap beer. + darts and some kick ass pinball, dog friendly, and pool tables. tastyness...

+ 1 for the fact that it was my friends birthday and they gave us a polaroid camera to take pictures with! very rad

-1 cause its called kilowatt instead of jigawatt...
author: justen e.

description:
I don't really have many cool descriptive words to toss around about this place.  It's a divey bar, with good beer selection, and two pool tables that have a list a mile long.

I'll often throw my name up on the chalkboards for each pool table, and head across the street to Delirium to grab a drink and a warmup game.  By the time I finish and head back to Kilowatt, I can grab a beer and play a game or two.  After that, it's at least another 40 minute wait before you can play again.

I don't seem to meet too many people, outside of the pool players, who are usually quite good, by the way.  (Pretty much the main thing that keeps me coming back.)  Cheap and varied types of beer is great, the waits kinda suck.  Overall, it's got good pool players, but is just kind of meh otherwise.
author: Jesse C.

description:
When my heart is set on Zeitgeist but the weather says no, where do I go? 

Kilowatt. And the reason is proximity, really. I'm not gonna lie. But this place has actually started to grow on me in recent months...

It's never obnoxiously crowded, but it's always full enough to stimulate good times.

It draws a good mix of people. Even sports fans, and I love it when they have sports on. Because I hate sports bars, but I wholeheartedly confess to loving sports.

The service is always good, too. The bartenders are fast and they never mind that I consistently steal olives and cherries from their little thingy on the bar (hey --- it's bold to put it so close to the edge, there...). 

And this is the one bar in all of SF where I've actually played darts; and I really enjoyed myself while doing so. Before that, I hadn't played darts since the Detroit days.

A sign that I'm really hitting my stride with Kilowatt, I suppose...
author: Lisa T.

description:
I NEVER run into people I know randomly.  Maybe it's because I'm a hermit.  Maybe it's because I have no friends and hate people.  Okay, that's not really true...I have friends.

In any case, walking into this place and seeing a buddy I've been meaning to contact along with having a great beer selection, pool, darts, and a nasty ass restroom.  This is the dive bar for me that I will definitely come back to!
author: Chris M.

description:
I swear every time I stop by to have a drink here, they are always playing horrible music...you know, the scream into the mic, can't understand a damn word, kill your mother/father/significant other, blow your eardrums type of music.  

They have a good selection of beers, which is why I'm giving it 3 stars.  Other than that, I think they should rename this place to Kill-o-Lot.
author: Cyrus R.

description:
This place is fine. They have cheap beer and, from what people keep telling me, a very attractive bartender (I haven't figured out which one it is, though...). They pour some strong drinks, too...if that's what you're into.
CASH ONLY, don't be a douche.
I think they should close the pool tables on Friday and Saturday nights, but hey, that's just me.
Watch out in the ladies room, there is a really tricky step, it's the cause of many bruises.
There are often dogs in this bar. So, if you're into that, you'd be into Kilowatt. 
Good place, 4 stars.
author: Meghan B.

description:
Blarg.
Now I remember why I never venture out to this part of the Mission.  Of all the bars on this side of the hood, Kilowatt deserves three stars.  The bar is large but too brightly lit for my taste; I really, really, really like dark bars.  The booze seemed cheap but I'm not sure because I didn't purchase my own (hell yes for getting dudes to buy your drinks!), and the bartenders seemed friendly enough.  We went on a Thursday and it was packed, but it was nice.  I'd go back again but would never abandon my Mission Bar for this place.
author: Meh M.

description: Overwhelming smell of BO when we walked in but I guess that's what you get when its 10pm on a Saturday night. We were lucky enough to find two bar stools at the bar. The best part were the purse/coat hook under the bar.  The bar tenders were very fast and attentive even with the growing number of barhoppers. There was a wall full wall of framed pictures of dogs....very interesting. The bar was stocked with dark beers...lots of beer I've never even heard of. My boyfriends dream :) there were two pool tables in the middle of the room...I guess if it weren't so packed it would make sense... the crowd of people were hipsters for the most part.... I'd come back for sure if I'm in the area... pretty decent pricing, cool crowd.
author: Penelope V.

description:
A good place to hang out and play darts, or just chat, or to drink yourself into a drunken stupor. Its all up to you. 

The drinks aren't too expensive, and its pretty low key. We went here on a Saturday, and it wasn't too crowded, although we might have been there too early for the bar crowd. What can I say - we're getting old and lame (we came here on my birthday, so I have to be at least a little bit reflective).
author: Dana L.

description: Great bar, nice bartenders, pool table, $4.50 gin and tonics. All I need
author: Marlen K.

description:
I walked into Kilowatt for the first time recently on a Monday night and thought to myself, "Hell, I should have come into this place sooner." Kilowatt is a solid rocker bar that isn't trying to hard to be anything other than a place where you can play Metallica on the jukebox and order booze. Cheap booze. It's not too trendy, not too dark, not too bright, heck not too anything other than a bar. It's almost like what I'd call a "dive bar lite".  Kinda think of it as a Lucky 13 that isn't trying quite as hard. And with less Dead Kennedys.

All in all a great spot for drinks whether you're a local or in the neighborhood.
author: Andy A.

description: This place is off the hook!! Walked into a great group of people.  The best part is the cheap booze, but the bonus was the lovely ladies!!
author: Jerry K.

description:
I must have a pool shark vibe about me.  Every time I go here, older guys always hit on me and/or try to get me to play a game a pool.  Which could be a good thing or a bad thing, depending on who you are.

Thought it was simply charming when the delightfully surly bartender snatched the $10 bill out of my hand for my drink.  Easy there, sweetness, it's not a penis and you are not working your second job.  She just needed a hug, I think.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
The new BF is trying to get me to go to different types of bars and so I got dragged here. I twas like the Hemlock Tavern but in the Mission and bigger. They show sports on the TV's and have two pool tables and darts.
Too many people in black, too many people at all.
author: Kim S.

description:
I've only really gone here during the weeknights, so I had no idea that Killowatt got as packed as last night. Apparently it wasn't even so busy. Who knew?

Bartenders are so awesome. Talk about a heavy pour and a great deal. Good smiles, all hugs, you get the picture. 

It's a great crowd too. So easy to just sit down at the bar and start chatting with the strangers next to you. I will definitely be back! :)
author: Annie T.

description:
Came here on the same night as when I went to Double Dutch
The bar is huge and we came early on a thursday night.
The bartender was cool, she just poured a bunch of pints for my few friend and I. The jukebox sucked. I think by now that big ass bar should already have a "internet jukebox"
A whole lot of heavy metal, which isnt bad, but it (jukebox) just looked old and ravaged and like no employee updated it at all.

It's obviously a dog friendly bar. My beer didnt quite taste the same as other beers ive had from other bars taps, maybe it wasnt fizzy or cold
something wasnt right. But im sure I'll be back here sooner or later.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
I have trouble with crowds, dins, and white belts.
Really, if not for these frailties O' mine, I might give it five stars.
author: Theo R.

description:
Friday night plans among girlfriends.

Let's go to 500 club?
Friend 1: Nah, too scurvy.
Let's go to Beauty Bar?
Friend 2: You're kidding me right?
Let's go to Amnesia?
Friend 3: Do you have amenisa? You've fucking lost it! There's no way I am stepping one foot into that place.
-Light goes off.
Duh, Kilowatt. 
How many bars does it take to get four girls drunk and happy? One if you're Kilowatt. 3 out of 3 friends agree.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Ohhh Kilowatt.  I do miss you.  
When I lived in the city, this was the single bar I went to most often.  Very easy place to walk into, sit at the bar, and have a beer.  No one bothers you unless you want to be bothered. Great juke box, cheap pool tables, darts, and most importantly RACER 5 ON TAP.....oooo baby.  And their location is tough to beat....16th between Valencia and Guerrero...what a great street.  Definitely worth checking out.
author: Kyle W.

description: There's nothing special here, you don't want to go here, you probably want to check out some other Mission bar.
author: Scott E.

description:
One word: Men. 

Yes a sea full of them too. We stumbled into this bar that we haven't been to yet. And on a Friday night it was full of people, mostly men...seemed more of a "regulars" bar to me. Apparently some men thought we had never gone to a bar before, because of us trying to learn the beer menu (excuuuuuuuuse us!). 

A good selection of beers on tap, along with the usual hard alcoholic drinks. The bartender served us right away, and was fairly nice! 

With a bunch of people around you can play pool, darts, or sneak your way to the back for some Pirates of the Carribean pinball. Trust me, you'd be tempted to play...the highest score was like 53 million! 
We hung out in that corner to veer away from the crowds, under the awesome "The King" in the bean decoration (giggles)...you just have to scope it out yourself!  And for the bathroom-it was okay & fairly clean, a lil tiny. 

Best of all, it looks like you can bring your dog along. Seemed like a few dogs were running around the night we went! :)
author: Catherine O.

description:
I really, really like this bar.

On 16th and Valencia with over half a dozen bars to choose from on any given night of the week, I'll choose this one.  It's probably twice the size of any of the other ones around, it's never retardedly packed and you can usually find a seat, a booth or even a spot at the bar.  It's just a super-chill non-pretentious, laid back place to grab a beer or a cheap stiff drink and play a round of pool.  

It's usually filled with grungy mission folk good for random and entertaining drunken conversations with strangers.  Go here and you're guaranteed to stumble away satisfied.
author: Shayna N.

description:
I attempted to go to the Elixir Absinthe party last night, but I couldn't penetrate the mob of boys, so my friends and I decided for a more relaxed evening at Kilowatt.  

It's your typical dive bar.  Dark.  Cheap drinks.  Red lighting. But what Kilowatt has that many other dive bars lack are the high booths.  They are cozy and private.  Good for drunken intellectual or not so intellectual chats with friends.  

Last night was an exceptionally special night.  For some reason the female bartender was very generous.  My friend went up to get drinks and when she came back she had two drinks on the house.  The bartender thanked my friend for her patience and said the first two drinks were on her.  Cool, but what?  She couldn't have been gone from the table for more than 5 minutes.  Sweet!
author: Alexis M.

description:
Been here at least a half dozen times, but this was the first time I've been lucid enough to actually remember the name.

It reminds me of bars I've been to in the midwest and texas.

Except they serve more than just Bud.

Good beer selection and cheap stiff drinks.
author: Rocco B.

description: Loud and can get crowded, but in a pretty good spot and all kinds of cheap drinks.  Also, Josh rules.
author: Byung Ho B.

description:
Went over here last night and was pretty impressed.

It's a beer and liquor bar, with two pool tables, some nice enclosed four person booths, a large jukebox and an astonishing amount of dogs.

The bar is surprisingly light by San Francisco, industrial in design and can get fairly crowded at times. Still, not bad, but could do with a bigger whiskey collection.
author: Iain T.

description:
Okay, not quite the kind of place you would normally find me in.  But I liked it either way.

I'm not a fan of the jukebox, since I couldn't find a lot of things that I liked, but I guess it wasn't annoying me either.  I like rock, just can't listen to it for more than like 30 minutes without getting bored or annoyed...lol

I don't drink alcohol no more, so I can't even tell you how the drinks are.  I tell you one thing, they had a wide selection of beers on tap and the young lady with the tats made me one helluva Shirley Temple.

I spent most of my time here talking to a friend and playing Nude Photo Hunt.  Not too bad at all.

They also have a few pool tables, a pinball machine, two dartboards, and lots of seating and tables.

Cool place, I can see myself coming back with the same people I went there with.  

Enjoy..=)
author: Mike V.

description:
Kilowatt has been a long standing favorite since seeing the leftovers of the Pixies, sans Frank Black & Kim Deal, playing to a packed, rowdy, bike messenger and bike messenger-wannabe crowd. "I still love you Kim... Le Sigh!" There were more tat's and black attire than there was beer in the place that night. 

These days "The Watt" is a gentrified (I use that loosely) 16th & Mish version of  Zeitgeist. Hoegaarten on tap. Unbeatable featured happy hour beer special (2.50/pint). A crowd that inspires longing for the Grunge band days. If you close your eyes, with a mouthful of porter, you'd swear that you could smell teen spirit. 

Bonus features besides that healthy beer list: booths, 2 pool tables, and they allow dogs.
author: Johnny C.

description: This place was superb.  The bar staff made my cocktail efficiently but with lots of attention to detail.  I would go here any day.
author: Jeff D.

description:
I heart dive bars and the Kilowatt has a slightly more upscale dive feel. It doesn't compare to my favorite dive bar in the world, 8ball in Ann Arbor but... This place gets crowded and yes people are drunk and last saturday some chick puked in the bathroom but isn't that what bars are good for. I like the decor, high ceilings, the photographs above the bar. The staff is nice and attractive, which is always good.
The best part of all is that they have darts. I have been scouring this city for darts and finally found a bar with some now I just need some people to play with.
author: Eryn L.

description:
This is pretty much a dive bar-- but its awesome... it's dog friendly, the beers are cheap and they have dartboards!  Im not very good w/ the darts so i have to be careful not to dart-my dog when playing...  
she likes to bark at everyone & has a great time eating whatever she can find on the ground...
author: Nicole G.

description:
It's quite sad but even though I grew up in the Bay Area, my friends and I never kick it SF. Now that I'm older and have realized the graveness of my mistake, I have made an effort to better explore the city of my childhood. 

So on a recent trip back to the Bay, my friends and I accompanied my SF savvy sister and went to the Mission District because in her words, "The people there are the real SF." This was one of the bars we hit.

We showed up at 10 pm at the place was EMPTY. The only people sitting at the bar were me, my two friends, and my sister. The place was a dive. But a nicely decorated dive bar. The bartenders were nice though and while the drinks were more expensive than Delirium, the bar we just left, the prices were still reasonable. 

In the back, there was a small dance floor. There were about ten people dancing but that small crowd consisted of a gay man wearing a hoody and daisy dukes, three African American people, and a couple of fobby Asian people who couldn't dance. 

The saving grace for this place was the music. There was a DJ who was spinning alot of hip hop and rap but from the past three decades so there was alot of variety.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
When my friend and I walked in around 5pm, we were possibly the only girls, that wouldnt be a problem except that all of the guys stared at us with weird looks, like thinking, " what are you girls thinking coming in here to drink?" We pushed the uncomfortable feelings aside and got two beers, which were at a good price of $2.75.  There are all sorts of good beers on tap, and I guess you are allowed  to bring your dog in there which would be rad if I owned one.  Instead I got stared at the entire time by a big german shepard maybe wanting my beer? who knows. 
Besides all of that:
Good beer, good happy hour prices, interesting atmosphere, right next to a rad thrift store...  I will return.
author: Sonya D.

description: Lots of beer options, okay seating on weekdays, not okay seating on weekends (typical Mission bar), cash only (typical Mission bar), 2 pool tables (long lines usually), 2 dartboards, and lots of TVs for sports-lovers like me.
author: Charles N.

description:
Must love dogs! Fine selection of beer, the sweetest puppies greeting you and a few pool tables? Hard to beat! I will be back! So far, my favorite local bar. I mean, dogs in a bar? Awesome. 
It can definitely get crowded, as the grouping was piling up a bit after 10 but, suffice to say there are plenty of other bars to wander to down 16th so, after a few rounds and staring contests with a few bored pups, you'll be ready to cross the street and wreck havoc in that direction. All in all, a decent dive-ish bar stop, that makes a unique mark with its animal-loving policies.
author: Jessica L.

description:
One of my Mission staples. 

Kilowatt is as unpretentious as Mission Dives get. The bartenders are curt, but not rude (hey, there's a LINE behind you, what do you expect?), drinks are totally reasonable, & it's spacious & not too loud in there.

When the plan is the Mission & the conversation steers its way to Kilowatt as a meetup location, I've never once steered it to someplace else. It may not be my all-time favorite Mission haunt, but it's the perfect standby.
author: Pete J.

description:
I'll keep this short.
Dope as shit. A great place for various creepy, crazy lectures from the sad and the jaded. Most of them start stories or thoughts with the preface of "you're probably gonna punch me in the face for saying this but..."
and then proceed to ramble and never make any face-punch worthy statements.
Outside is just as fun: this homeless dude offered to recite some poetry for free after I explained that I had no change to spare. He was actually pretty good! Granted I was walking out of a bar at the time.
author: JAYCE B.

description:
The kilowatt is in my regular bar rotation and there's a lot to like about the place.  It's a pretty big space with booths, tables and the bar area.  You can be amongst the crowd or hole up in a booth or on the little platform area in the back if you want to just be amongst your peeps.  

There's alot to do at the Kilowatt which is a main part of the appeal for me.  They have a bunch of TVs and take their sports pretty seriously for a mission dive bar.  They have the NFL Sunday ticket and people also go to watch hoops and hockey.  If watching sports isn't your thing, there's a bunch of bar games to keep you occupied.  They have two pool tables and there are lots of good players who frequent the Kilowatt.  The first table is pretty competitive almost any time they're open and the second table is a little mellower for those who aren't quite so serious.  They have 2 dartboards in the back, some pinball and, of course, photohunt.  Or, you cant just hang out and listen to the juke which is excellent.  More Dinosaur Jr. gets played here than any other bar I know.  That scores points with me. :-)

The crowd is pretty standard for the mission.  There are lots of regulars and alot of the people who work at zeitgeist and other places will also hang out here.  The bartenders are all quite good though I do miss Andy who made the best bloody marys in recorded history.    

All in all, it has everything I look for in a bar and it's a relaxed and comfortable place.  I can't wait until football season when I pretty much live at the Kilowatt on Sundays.  Good times.
author: Zach J.

description:
I had forgotten how much I like this bar.  The drinks are reasonably priced - $7 for a rum&coke and an Anchor Steam.   The customers were all friendly and unpretentious.  Plenty of seating and room to move (though it was Tuesday).

Best of all, They have 2 pool tables for only 50 cents a game and a good pool table culture, i.e. no doubles and winner stays.  It attracts some talent, but makes for pretty short waits between games. Last night, I shot for a truly horrid 1 win and 9 losses, even managing to lose to the girl drinking Xanax-coladas and sliding off her stool.  Hooray.

All in all a great time though.  I met some cool regulars and this place  has way more girls than my other usual pool spot, Molotov's. 

Also, props to the bartender for getting Xanax girl safely to a cab - alone.
author: matt c.

description:
Best bar is SF. Here is why:

1. Killer jukebox if you like hard rock and metal. I ran into Matt Pike from High on Fire here. That pretty much says it all.

2. Cheap drinks. I've been here about 500 times, and never realized how cheap it is because I always get wasted. Just recently someone pointed out that you can get like 5 drinks for $20 and I realized why I always get so wasted.

3. Pictures of people's dogs and motorcycles. They're everywhere.

4. Relatively low hipster factor.

5. Some semblance of a hockey theme.

I'm not gonna lie - this probably isn't the best place to try to throw your game around. However, if you want a killer atmosphere for boozin' and rockin' out, look no further.
author: Dan M.

description:
This place has one of the great jukeboxes in the city, and although I generally have a hard time convincing friends to go here, I end up here every now and then anyway.  

One time, during a weekday happy hour, I was the only person seated at the bar.  I was killing time before a Nick Cave show at the Warfield, and the bartender started talking about rocknroll music with me.  He told me a story about how he'd worked at the Great American Music Hall years earlier.  Mark Lanegan was scheduled to play there one night, but didn't show up for sound check.  Apparently, he'd been busted just outside the venue trying to purchase contraband from an undercover police officer.  

That's pretty much the whole story, and at the time I found it fascinating.  

The same thing could probably happen outside of the Kilowatt, were it a live music venue.  

Which might be a good thing, depending on what sort of tall tales you're looking for in this, the city of midnight fairy tales.

Sort of.
author: Gopal R.

description:
When I was finished I walked to Kilowatt, my old dive bar hangout, and had an IPA. The same rock bodied bartendress was there form my early 20s and she told me that recently she had studied dog homiotherapy and I witnessed her take a whining puppy and calm it to sleep, cradled in her arm, while she calmed the happy hour lonely guys to sleep with her beer and lack of pretentiousness. Refreshing in the Mission. In the Mission, pretentiousness and sincerity are at war and both are your key in and key out of a potentially stagnant culture which in its own variety is the antithesis of variety and yet a primordial soup of art and non-yuppie middle class people.

And I felt free, and that is almost all that matters in the world.
author: Rocker D.

description:
Free pool Sundays on little bar tables that they just re-felted (is felted a word?). This is a place where either: I've never played on a bar table before and it felt like a toy compared to a 9' table, but man you get a steady stream of players writing their name up on the board and it is a lot of fun. Everyone who plays is super friendly too. I love it.

I also sunk a few bucks into one of their two pinball tables and declare myself the worst pinball player on the planet. Still, a fun bar that allows dogs, external food (have to run across the street for a burger) and did I mention free pool Sundays?
author: Jordan M.

description:
Meh.  

I didn't like it.  Went here with the girls couple nights ago.  The people in here (when I went) were sleazy old males eyeing us up and down.  I felt violated just by sitting there.  The music was loud and horrible.  Maybe if it had a better girl/guy ratio, some better music, and younger people it would have a chance with me.  But it was big and almost empty.  Which means it was boring.  Zzzzzzz.
author: Mary R.

description:
3.5 stars, rounding up.

the missus and i got d-runk here on friday night when we were out celebrating her completion of the bar exam.  good times!  (well, mostly.  i can't say that saturday from 2:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. was all that much fun, but that disaster was completely of our own making.)

anywho, about the bar itself.  they have a pretty nice selection of beers on tap (but did i need to drink 80 oz. of them?  probably not), two pool tables, a couple of dart boards, and a lively, youngish crowd.  it ain't the fanciest, cleanest, brightest, or roomiest place around, but if that's what you're looking for, you probably shouldn't be checking out bars in the mission anyway.
author: Jeff W.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here last night (Saturday) at about 1:15 am to grab a drink before going home.

It was packed, but we still managed to get our drinks within 5 minutes. Very nice! My cranberry vodka was quite strong, so that was good.

Decent place, but my boyfriend describes it as an "institution." I felt a bit out of place. A lot of loyal locals come here. Though I do fully enjoy seeing the cute cute healthy doggies. =)
author: Angela H.

description:
Great bar!
* The drinks are cheap.
* They have two dart boards in the back. (with real darts)
* Pool table.
* You can bring in your dog.
* The bar is pretty big and you can usually find a table if you're with a few people.
author: Jackie G.

description:
As the only bar I know of around town that serves New Belgium Sunshine on tap (the only beer I can find that even compares to Hitachino White Nest Ale), Killowatt automatically rules; however, the reasonably douchey after work crowd tends to slightly sour the delicious taste and pleasant effects of this beer. And nobody fucks with my beer, particularly when I'm drinking good beer instead of swill for once and particularly x 2 when I'm drinking beer that I can't find anywhere, not even the goddamn BevMo!

Luckily, Erotic Photohunt (again, the babes not the dudes) saves the day as do the friendly and fast bartenders. And I'll add an extra star to this review just because a Killowatt bartender once played "Reign in Blood" in its entirety.  And that ruled hard; especially because indie rock queen herself, Julie Andrews, was sitting next to me, totally appalled.
author: Chloe S.

description:
EDITED 2/6/08

I had originally written a long entry chewing out a girl for writing a completely ignorant and false review, and as it turns out, she felt compelled to delete her entire account. My work here is done. 

And now for my real review:

I like to think that a bar is only as good as its staff and regulars. And the regulars here are nice, loyal, and hilarious. After a while it does feel like a family. The staff is unparalleled in both personality and efficiency. 

Watch out for the pool sharks, everyone there plays like they're on the pro circuit, I got my ass handed to me several times by an old but hilarious man named Jack.  Do NOT mess with Jack.

The men's bathroom is awkward from what I hear, the women's bathroom can be one of those places where you walk in alone and walk out with 8 new best friends who all LOVE your shoes. Last night I had to yell at a dude who thought it was perfectly acceptable to use the women's bathroom, and to be honest that happens here a lot. What the hell dudes? Pee in your designated area!

Aaaaaand for the best part, the computer game thingy. I'm part of a small but talented league called the Touchmaster Masters, look for my name in the number 2 spot on the erotic photo hunt scoreboard. That game is addicting. Seriously, we call playing that game 'smoking the crack pipe.'

I don't recommend coming here on a Friday or Saturday, unless you're a crowd person. It's gotten to where it takes ten minutes of "excuse me" "oh sorry" "can i get past you?" to get to the back. 
And another tip? If you see a dude carrying a case of beer or empty glasses, get out of the way! He's helping to get you drunk!
author: Jb O.

description: Love this place. They've got a chill atmosphere, a huge beer selection, and DARTS! I also love that the darts area is elevated at the back of the place. It allows for uninterrupted, semi-private space that overlooks the rest of the bar. Cash only spot. Playing darts is free, but you need a $10 deposit to borrow the dart set.
author: Julie T.

description: Nothing special about this spot. The drinks and staff are fine but never impress. I think they survive by virtue of their location, but there are many better options within a 2-block radius.
author: Quinn S.

description: Easily my favorite SF bar. The pool players are generally excellent but not too excellent, not snobby and not territorial. The competitive nature of the two bar tables is exactly what I like. Comfortable places to sit. Good beers on tap. Ms. Pac Man for when there's no Giants game on or while waiting for your turn to beat one of the many fine regulars at a game of house-rules 8-ball. I've hesitated to write a review because it almost seems like a secret that should be kept - the problem is that with 332 reviews and a prime location, it isn't a secret and never will be. The place is usually crowded at night and even during the day the wait for a challenge is at least 4-5 people long, if not more. To me, that's a plus.
author: Henry M.

description:
