What's up Camper, I'm from the "Look Ma I'm Slumming!" crowd from North of Market, and I was here last Saturday.  Touche!

It's decent, but what's up with all the unutilized space in the back?  There were several groups scouting out tables, while they could've easily put up some more tables back there.  Also, the Magnet Bar has more dogs.
author: Rego S.

description:
The votes have been counted, and the results are in.  The Kilowatt is officially my favorite place.  Congratulations, Kill-a-slut.  You've earned it.  

I think it was the booths that stole my heart away.  Big booths in front  and back.  And pinball.  And the dirty video match game.  I fucking love that shit.  And that one bartender who reminds me of that one guy I used to know.  And enough metal on the jukebox to scare away douchebags who wander in.  

I mean, you're not like a fancy party dress that I can't wait to wear, but more like my favorite pair of jeans that I look hot in, no matter how dirty they are.

And as if I needed more proof that this place is awesome, when I stopped in on a random Sunday afternoon I saw no less than THREE of my favorite bartenders in town just hanging out there drinking.  It's my favorite new alone time bar.  I don't know any of the skeezers there yet, and I'm gonna try to keep it that way.  It's a lot funner to hang out if everyone in the bar hasn't seen you totally shitty.

EDIT:  7/11/07

My love, it grows and grows.  When you're totally pissed off on Sunday afternoon, and don't want to see any of your goddamn friends, but just listen to metal, drink beer, and play the shit out of some pinball, where ya gonna go?  

KILOWATT.  Ghostface Killa was right.  All around the world today, the Kilo IS the measure.
author: Coco D.

description:
I saw Jawbreaker and Zeni Geva there.  

Fastest bar drink order I have received in a long time.  Great lady bartender, packed with a sharp style of gorgeous and stylish body art.   Triple-double tip in a bar with sports.
author: Rusty M.

description:
I realize the entrance might be a little intimidating if youre not comfortable with the random dogs, bikers, and whoever else that walk in.  But, I thought it was fine.

So, for the person looking for a non-white person to walk in.. well.. I did yesterday and had a good time.

We just had a couple drinks, the guy behind the bar was friendly, told me the special, a summer wheat beer, and it was a great deal.

Ambiance is about what youd expect but it was comfortable, easy going, and despite the presence of dogs, no sh*t on the floor!

haha
author: Cyrus S.

description: Killowatt is my first neighborhood bar.  Strolling over for a Stone Pale Ale and shooting pool was always a great place to be.  Definitely a top fav city bar.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
What do we have here? A dive bar? On 16th and Valencia? With dogs?

Okay, so not the most uncommon thing in the area. In fact, maybe the quantity of these places is a bad thing and is why 16th reminds me more of Rush Street in Chicago than the hispanic grit that the mission is supposed to be know for. But, Kilowatt stands out from most of it's surroundings for me.

They have a pinball machine, which is an immediate plus, and all the bartenders have seemed to be real people as opposed to the traditional San Francisco fare (e.g., you ponder if they turned in a head shot with their application).

Best of all, it doesn't have a theme. If it's supposed to, they didn't do a very good job of expressing it. Which is awesome. It's just a bar.

Drinks are reasonably priced and everyone seems friendly. The place has a casual haunt, regulars kinda vibe, which is rare in the city. I like it.
author: Aiden B.

description: any place that allows dogs and has TURBONEGRO on the juke box is automatic 5 stars
author: Erik L.

description:
Cheap drinks, and an ice hockey themed decor.  Of course the boyfriend loves this place.

Good neighborhood bar. Never had a bad time in here.  

Don't wear heels in here, or you'll stand out.  Or be like me and don't care.  I was dressed up to go bar hopping in skinny jeans, heels, and a halter top and everyone looked at me like I was from another country.  But once I got over the stares, and ordered a beer, the stares stopped.  

Still had a good time.  Just don't come overdressed or if you do, ignore the stares and they'll stop.  

Bathroom is gross though.  Pee squatting, or pee at home.
author: Denise B.

description: I like Kilowatt because it's a good size, not too small and crowded and never too empty.  It's kind of dark and danky, but the bathrooms are always relatively clean- thumbs up on that one.  There are usually booths open and stools if you don't go on a weekend.  It's a great place to hang out with friends or stare at the TVs, or be weird like that girl I saw yesterday sitting at the dark bar reading a book.
author: Skye W.

description:
I used to go to 'the watt' all the time.  I mean, 6 days a week.  I think that one week I was 86'd two or three times.  Believe that?  I know, stupid.

Anyway, the drinks are strong and the bar is crowded.  Just typical Mission bar wit some pool tables.

Used to be a really big coke bar.  I don't see as many people sniffing the mirror like they used to.  Makes for a more pleasent night.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Four stars for sheer hipster divey rock and rollin'. I haven't been to the Kilowatt in years, and ended up coming here last Friday night with some co-workers I ran into in the Mission after dinner at Bar Tartine. One of the co-workers was WASTED ASS DRUNK and so I ended up doing a lot more baby sitting and damage control than I wanted to. When I wasn't trying to manage (a.k.a. avoid) a liquor fueled breakdown/TMI confessional, I had a chance to appreciate all the reasons I still love the Kilowatt:

1) Loud, good music
2) No frills drinking
3) Cute hipster guys standing in little pods, too shy to talk to the ladies
4) Dogs wandering around
5) No one really looks twice, or even once, when people fall down. And many people fall down.

After happy hour in the FiDi and dinner at an overpriced restaurant, the Kilowatt was the antidote I needed.
author: Angie R.

description:
when I was 21 years old I came here several times a week. At that time in my life i was also a borderline alcoholic , and was fond of (gag) whiskey sours. I would wake up in a pool of my own whiskey induced sweat and wanted to commit suicide. I had problems!

I like this place for several reasons:

1. it is a large place, you will never feel claustro.
2. a great ass jukebox
3. hot bartenders
4.touch screen games where I will kick anyones ass in music trivia , just try my ass
5.pool tables


they also used to have these great condiments for martinis or something called Tamolives which were a strange voodoo hybrid but they sure were pickly tasting goodness.
author: Lauren V.

description: Eh this place is ok. Two pool tables doesn't make it a pool hall. For locals in the area this is a great dive to hang out at I'm sure. It's pretty chill. Never really crowded. It gets two stars because how many places have good beer selections in SF? A lot. 2 pool tables a pinball machine couple dart boards.... eh ok. So nothing really wow's me. Maybe my mind will be changed some time.
author: Christopher F.

description:
I play darts here. Don't even try to touch my skills. After warming up with a few pints of Boont the domination is unstoppable. To top it off they recently got new dartboards.

Good place to meet up with peoples as tables are usually readily available. A pitcher for each of my friends please barkeep, we don't need no stinkin glasses.

Good beer selection.
author: Willie K.

description:
One star?  Yes, of course I have an axe to grind.

I live around the corner from this bar, and have been here about 10 times.

What's this bar have to offer?  Beer.  Some decent people.  Maybe a game of pool if you're lucky.  That's enough to make me like, even love a bar.  But I don't like or love Kilowatt.

I went in there on Saturday early evening, and this brunette bartender carded my girlfriend and I.  Now my girlfriend is 21, blonde, and younger than her age when she's not wearing makeup, etc.  The bartender went to consult with a co-worker on her ID (which was from Georgia).  No problem.

When she came back, she was saying "oh, I apologize about that, you have to understand that its a $5000 fee if we serve someone under-age, and this ID is kind of beat up."  I guess she had also never seen a Georgia ID.  We laughed and said "No problem, now can we order?"  Apparently there was a misunderstanding.  She was not going to serve us.  Because of her own ignorance.

So we went home, got another picture ID and a copy of her birth certificate (hey, we live around the corner).  When we went back, we showed it all to the doorman who promptly let us in (and apparently refused to relay that information to the bartender).  So when I order drinks, we have to show it all to the bartender _again_, who claims that she doesn't even have a doorman (when I point him out to her, she gets bitchy and has a sarcastic-wink-seizure), and refuses to serve us based solely on her desire to prove a point.  Get off your high-horse, power tripping bartender!

I wish I could say that this whole saga was a solitary event in a long love affair with this bar, but its not.  It's indicative of what the bar is like.

(There is one bartender who is a big guy with curly hair, and he is the exception.  He's an awesome guy.)
author: Braden T.

description: Okay, I so rarely go to bars that are not located downstairs from where I live. (I live above the broken record, yelp it.) Partially because of laziness and partially because I don't have an adventurous spirit. I went here last night on a birthday trail, and I have to say it was mad fun! Drinks are strong and decently priced plus they gave us a bottle of champagne because it was my friend's birthday. Holla! I had a great time; the people seemed nice enough and the staff was very nice too. If I can get my lazy ass down here again, I'm sure I'll have a great time.
author: Jessica R.

description:
This was always my favorite dive bar in SF.  Friendly folks, good beer, and not too crusty.  It's a nice mix of people, and I always feel like there is enough room to navigate.  

I returned to SF after 5 years of living elsewhere and the place hadn't changed. I was so relieved.
author: Lulu B.

description:
This is a very basic joint, just a bar, a handful of good regional micros, and some TV's. 
No food, but you can run across the street and bring some back. 
I've never seen a band play here, it's just a good place to drop in for a pint or two after/before dinner elsewhere in the Mish.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I wouldn't really describe this place as "dingy" or "dirty" like some others. It felt more like a generic sports bar to me, nothing really that interesting. 

Three things, however, make me give it 3 stars instead of 2: fairly cheap drinks, pear cider on tap, and lack of pretentious atmosphere. An okay place, but definitely not worth going out of your way for.
author: Annee T.

description:
Two words: Retarded Crowded

I imagine that means it is a good bar. But I couldn't tell.
author: Alexis B.

description: Everybody know this place but for some reason I'd never been here.  Well, that oversight has been cured and cured good.  Great place, nice bartenders, lots of seating and a good juke box.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Corey V.

description: Matusis' review says it all. They have two pool tables and some dodgy dart boards. Dive bar with pub games. Nice.
author: Bob G.

description:
For some reason I had been hesitant to go in here... Don't know. Something about it. Not for the last time in my life I turned out to be wrong.

Nice place. Cheap drinks. Bartender was cool. Wasn't too busy (it was Wednesday). Good darts setup and they only charge a deposit! Has a sort of biker bar feel, but mostly it was just a solid place. Thumbs up, I'd go back.
author: Matt C.

description: I stumbled in here with some friends to celebrate a birthday, there was a huge crowd outside, and as we entered the bouncer informed us that they were shooting a porno inside, and if we were okay with it we needed to sign waivers. YEAHDUH.  So after the paper work was done...let me just say things got a little rough,  I won't go into the details of the porn, but it was rough.  I was kind of worried about where to sit because I didn't want to sit near where they were filming, kind of icky... It was quite a spectacle (and I was lucky enough to get some pretty interesting pictures on my phone).  But the bar provided free drinks and pizza for as long as they were shooting the film, which was amazing.  It was a bizarre experience, but I'm glad I did it, a great story to tell.  As for the bar, it's a typical San Francisco dive bar with cheap drinks.
author: Sarah G.

description:
You can all stop whining about this great watering hole not having live live music any longer.  The best show of gratitude in the world is when Turbo Negro hung out here after their last show because Peter gave them a big break by letting them play there back in the day when pseudo homo metal wasn't so cool.
Great bar to watch all the sports you can handle because they have the hockey & football packages. Mmmmm, packages...
author: Colleen B.

description:
Hands down my favorite neighborhood bar, and it's definitley better than all the mediocor alternatives accross the street.

They've got a fucking fantastic beer selection, available by the pitcher, for more than reasonable prices. Even with the wide selection they have available they do a good job at keeping the beer fresh. There's a couple of pool tables, but what really does it for me is the two dart boards in the back (recently replaced)! and usually vacant. 

The bartenders are "rough & tough" and don't exactly "serve you with a smile" but once you've been in a couple of times you can flag down a bartender & get a drink in your hand faster than you can say "another one please".
author: Jeff S.

description:
I'll always have a soft spot for Kilowatt because it was here where my current man & I had our first "real" conversation back when we were just starting to date. Actually, we weren't even dating yet; he was interested, I was skeptical, but he seemed so sure of himself... but I digress. 

The drinks are cheap, it's right around the corner from my place, and on that night when E & I were getting to know each other, I went in wearing my most unflattering pair of jeans and my dad's coat (long story), and no one in the bar seemed to care. Oh and like others have mentioned, there's a pinball machine in the back. It also reminds me of this pub in Bretagne, France that I stumbled into 2 years ago, so an extra star for the nostalgia factor. 

Minus one star for the [rock? metal? I don't know!] music. I'm not open-minded when it comes to music, so if it's not on KMEL or KBLX, I don't like it! But that's just me.
author: Iris V.

description: Came here last night with G for his friend's Bon Voyage party - Typical dive bar but I think it has its own unique quirks. They had a lot of different beers on tap to choose from but we always stick with Stella. There was a few pool tables and some serious players were on it last night - they were quite into the game and I think we bothered them by bumping into them the whole night but I'm still alive so you know this place isnt' known for their shankings. Cool place overall - I would come here again (Oh and cash only!).
author: Kelly T.

description:
Kilowatt draws folks from around the City to its flame.  Hipsters, hippies, and yippies expanding their social comfort zone should hit the Kilowatt any night of the week.  The few times I've gone the vibe has been low key, yet cool. Not the euphemistic "Marina Cool": cliched over-exposure or the wealth=worth mentality found in slick financial district nightspots. 

The bartenders are attentive and the drinks: strong and cheap.  Extensive seating makes it the perfect spot for a girls' night and the steady pool game makes meeting new people straightforward.
author: Amy K.

description:
Kilowatt is ELECTRIC!  Sorry...that was corny...and those kinds of jokes don't fly at this place...
This place is awesome, I feel like i can go there looking like a complete scrub and still fit in.  It's totally awesome!!  This is da place to be if you want to be around other drunkards and that's what i love about it.  You can get annihilated at this place and it's totally okay to do.  I love the bathroom references to this place too, because it's so true...I mean the bathroom is so small and smelly, but it's totally what gives this place the character it deserves.   The people here are all really chill too which makes for a great drunk atmosphere.  Playing pool here is awesome as well, but everyone is like a freaking pro at this place.  I like to play and bet shots on games even though i suck, but it's still cool.  I recommend this place for drinkers and non snobby people.
author: christopher h.

description: In the middle of our little Mission bar crawl, my friend and I finally found ourselves sipping a tasty happy hour porter at the Kilowatt. I wish I could remember the bartenders name, because I really think you all need him to make you a margarita.
author: Mez L.

description:
A great bar for a cold Sunday night! 

I hate having to pee here!
author: Maddy S.

description: The dim lighting, pool table and dart board may deem it to be the average dive bar but it exceeds the average dive with its good vibes and jukebox music, inexpensive drinks, and doggie shrine. I was surprised to see a couple cute dogs when i walked in. The bartenders are really nice and laid back. Just remember to bring cash; most bars in the mission are cash only.
author: Katie D.

description: This is hands down one of my favorite bars in San Francisco, and one of the cleanest nicest bars you will find in the "dive-bar" category - including the ladies restroom. There is quite a bit of seating here, a dog-friendly policy, two pool tables, two dart boards, pinball and Ms. Pac-Man. The bartenders are cool, friendly and make decent, reasonably priced drinks. Collectively all of this makes the Kilowatt one corner in my own personal heaven.
author: J F.

description: totally fun bar to meet up with friends (and possibly surprise your bf with cupcakes on his birfday!) really friendly staff, good seating, music is just right. beer choice for the evening: mothership wit. yum. so the whole purpose of going here was the use the pool tables and darts.. but they were always full. so we are going to have to go back on a non-weekend time for that. the chicks bathroom was clean which is a huge plus. don't like cash only places, but i'll let it slide. pups allowed in bar = awesome.
author: Abigail W.

description: Pretty chill place, there were a lot of bums out front but it was pretty late when I decided to wander in. The beer was delicious and reasonably priced everything is listed on a huge blackboard on the wall, nothing over $5 really. The bartenders were hard rock kind of guys but real chill and down to earth.
author: Mike S.

description:
Besides serving my favorite beer "Hop Rod Rye" this review is solely based on the jukebox. You're really making me feel fucking old now. Pavement, Sonic Youth, Melvins, Pixies, Mudhoney? This is 1989 right?
Has the jukebox been updated in 15 years? Maybe I can bring over my Dinosaur Jr., Replacements, Husker Du CD's. How about some Big Black? Is the new music out there not worthy, or are you guys just lazy?
At this time I really don't care. Glen Danzig sounds sweet to me.
author: Tim S.

description:
Hipsters everywhere! But lots of fun with the right crowd. Plus they have Czechvar!

Almost as many hipsters here than your typical American Apparel.
author: Rocky K.

description: One of my favorite bars in the Mission cuz of the cheap drinks! :) It's cash only though and parking is always difficult to find in the Mission :(
author: Jess H.

description: Sarcastic bartenders and cheap beer! If you like pool tables, darts and hard rock this is your place. Can't wait to return.
author: Roger H.

description: Pretty legit bar. Ms. pac man, good beer with a smile and dogs. Also is not usually overcrowded.
author: Tamrin H.

description:
I love this bar. 

When I was in Providence I got into the habit of frequenting my local bar every night at the end of the night for a couple of jamesons to bring me down from the 8 24oz. cups of coffee that I had consumed during the day. 

This was the first bar that I went in that I felt comfortable going into alone and rarely got bothered by anyone at all.

I met some of the regulars and found some friends at the same time. It's a great dive bar that reminds me of home (TX). It's chill, non-chalant and I appreciate the we don't give shit and we don't take shit attitude. Now if they could just carry Lone Star......
author: Melissa R.

description: Finally, a real dive bar. All metal jukebox, $3.50 pints, darts, pool, and dog friendly on the weekend. This bar is one of the reasons that I moved to the neighborhood. Good for going solo or with friends. Very chill vibe. Did I mention that they always play metal? Awesome.
author: dan s.

description:
This bar is okay. Good happy hour prices - $3.25 all beers for the most part. There are a couple pool tables in the back, spacious booths and a long bar. The ambiance is pretty cool, usual stained wood bar but some interesting shwag on the walls.

Again, a good place to add to the bar crawl. No point staying at one bar for more than a couple of hours (unless you're getting your thang on.)

Oh ya, try the RADEBERGER beer. It's the small black tap handle towards the front door end of the bar that has Radeberger in gold cursive. Beer comes in a giant glass stein and is a refreshing golden pilsner.
author: Matt S.

description:
i definitely bookmarked Kilowatt when i was still drunk.
i don't remember my night here but my note says "hot, tarzan, & cherry bomb"
sounds like a good time to me!
author: Lizzy L.

description: Alcohol. Pool. Pinball. Darts. I spent about an hour here with some friends, so not a lot to go on, but 3 stars thus far. Guinness on tap is a plus for me.
author: Ken L.

description: Stop #2 during a 14-hour pub crawl. I remember sports themes, pool tables, and the beers were good and, like everything else in Mission it seems, cheap too.
author: Pierre Trudeau I.

description: #3 on my 5 Best Bloody Mary's List...also a great jukebox and amazing beer on tap selection and some pool tables too! All around good time.
author: Josh C.

description: Update: This has become my favorite bar in the Mission, period. The staff are awesome people, and the jukebox is one of the best I've become used to hearing. Another plus is if you're hungry and want some taqueria grub with your beer, don't be afraid to bring it in with you.
author: Sean R.

description: I get so bombed everytime I got here its amazing. Minus one star because I couldnt really tell you anything about the bar.
author: Sean K.

description: Many years ago, when this place had live music, I boned some guy in the sound booth on a dare.  I think he might have been the soundguy but it was quite some time ago and I really can't even be sure.  Now that sound booth is a vacant outpost which reminds me only of better days.  But no matter, it's still fun to get drunk here.  I secretly hope that someday this place will fill up with dogs, who will then coalesce into an angry, foaming pack of wild, crazy fang.  They will create a doggy Thurnderdome, and instead of a still interesting Mel Gibson and Tina Turner, white-belted hipsters and straight-haired Marina chicks in open-toed shoes will dart around slashing at each other to escape. Oh, a girl can only dream.
author: Eggs M.

description: Play some darts, drink some beer, and bring lots of people!
author: Liz B.

description: When I pee in urinals, I don't spit in them at the same time, like many guys do, because I am classy, except for here, because here, I spit in urinals, while I pee, and it makes me smile.
author: Dave G.

description: Why have I NEVER been here until last week? It's a great place! The beer selection is pretty good (and HUGE), pool tables in the back, games everywhere, and yikes, this place is pretty huge for a dive bar. Loved it! (I love dive bars in general) The bartenders were extra cool, too, and everyone in here was pretty friendly. It's a great place to go with your friends if you're just looking to have lots of fun. Or if you don't want to go to Skylark. Seriously. It's right across the street!
author: Caroline L.

description:
fun dive in the mission. cute, CUTE boy flirted with me at the bar, but i think his girlfriend was, umm, sitting right next to him. i think he wanted to talk about more than the fernet i was ordering, but i told him he was SOL. that's how i like to roll these days. no more men for me (i'm on sabbatical in every aspect of my life)!

i played the addams family pinball machine and scored 80 million points, but ended up in last place. WTF?!? people have WAY too much time on their hands.
author: May T.

description: They have Sunshine Wheat on tap and they don't judge you when you have alcohol induced issues with gravity...Good times!!!
author: Todd E.

description: Really?  I walked in and country music was bouncing off the walls and the place was sparsely occupied by bored 20-30 somethings who seemed to be in a purgatory between hipster and tweaker.
author: Christine M.

description: Kilowatt is pretty sweet. Cheap beers from everywhere. Most of it is on tap. Their specials can be great, just keep in mind, it's very divey. Don't take your high maintenance girlfriend or boyfriend there or else they'll just be whiney and lame. There's pool, there are little cocktail tables, it's just your mellow mission bar with a ton of awesome beers to try out.
author: Anthony B.

description: Cheap pitchers, 2 pool tables, darts, and doggies!  Not bad.
author: Mari C.

description: Please disregard Amanda's review of terrible service; I had a front row seat for this incident and the bartender was actually very patient with this obnoxious drunk. When Amanda first came up to the bar, she turned to my friends, and out of the blue, demanded, "Are you talking about me???" She then ordered a round of Red Headed Sluts, not difficult but not exactly a simple mixed drink. She didn't think they tasted right so the bartender remade them. A bit later, Amanda came back to the bar, ordered another round with the caveat "can you make them right this time?" At this point, the bartender told Amanda that she'd been making Red Headed Sluts since 1999 (the last time they were popular) and that if she didn't like the drinks, she could take her money elsewhere. We gave the bartender a standing ovation as Amanda exited the bar in a huff.
author: Catherine C.

description: Love the Watt! Great dive with great Rock N' Roll attitude! Cheap drinks, pool, pinball, in the middle of 16th street, tons of great grub right out the door!
author: Rachel L.

description: I've been here a few times but never really had any reason to say why I like it or not. But last night I watched the bartender make my margarita in a pint glass, filling it up more than halfway with tequila, triple sec, and something else...then proceeded to squeeze 3 fresh limes and then top it off with a splash of mix. Wasn't expecting such a carefully crafted beverage from a grungy mostly beer and pool mission spot. I dig it.
author: Kelly R.

description: I have a friend nicknamed Kilowatt. That's not really relevant to this write-up, and you likely won't find his sort hunching over this bar stool. Kid don't believe in no black or female presidents... no sir. Something about pigment and PMS respectively. Don't hate, don't hate, he'll scream as a mob of motherly oakland types beat him with handbags and pimped-rims. I took him to this bar once, we sort of just sat at the counter exchanging glances with the curiously strong-looking bar waitress, she with the tattooed arse. The latter arousing a synchronized seating adjustment. We didn't have much to say to each other. He went off to the bathroom at one point, dashing back minutes later with manic energy to recount with great pride, "Dude! That was the shit!"
author: Marc M.

description: If you're out drinking in this area you'd be hard pressed to find a better option within a few blocks.  With a great selection on the jukebox that covers everything from the Reverend Horton Heat, to Johnny Cash, to the Butthole Surfers you know at the very least you're in for a good soundtrack to your evening.  Add to this the decent beer selection and good bar staff and you have the makings for a great night out.
author: Joshua W.

description: Great beer selection, decent music playing, a real happy hour and close to some delicious places to eat  -  not too shabby.
author: Mike J.

description:
mission bars unite!!  

that's usually how i feel when in this area, because its impossible to stay at any one bar for an extended period of time.  so much to see, so many beers to have, so much puking in the alleyway to do, so many bacon wrapped hot dogs to consume!

I can handle this one for longer.  It gets crowded, yes...but if you score a booth you are golden, or just head back past the bar and hang out by the pool tables or dart boards where there is usually more standing room.  But be honest...booths are always better...especially when its one of the last stops, and personal space isn't as important anymore.
author: Lauren F.

description: I had a good time. I guess that's all you can ask from a bar. The bar had plenty of my favorite bar stuff. Pool tables, cheapish drinks,etc.. However it was crowded. Packed house crowded. The atmosphere was good with only a handful of idiots. The pool tables had long lines but I would definitely go back. If you are in the Mish and are wondering where to go, then Kilowatt would be one of the first places I mentioned.
author: Greg H.

description: When my friends from out of town wanted to go out in the city but not a place that was pretentious.  I asked my friends that live in the city of a few bars that would be mellow, serve good drinks and we could talk.  Found it in Kilowatt.  We were going to start out there and check out some more bars but as the night went on we decided to stay here for the night and had a great time.  Good waiters, the bartenders were great and the Bar back stepped up and helped out.  Will definitely be going back.  I must say though don't go here if you are looking for anything more than a great dive bar.
author: Heather B.

description: good trashy place to get trashed. Dogs allowed.
author: alec m.

description: Bartender= Super friendly, Watching hockey games at Kilowatt= Super fun! Go Sharks!
author: R G.

description:
so many dreams live and die here.

so many friends come and go here.

so many moments to watch and drink here.

god bless you, Kilowatt.   god bless you.
author: C H.

description: A nice spacey dirty bar with both pool and dart tables. They've got nice beers. The music is not my favorite, but after a couple of pitchers with your friends it'll be fine.
author: Tamas K.

description: My first bar in the bay... Ah it seems like only yesterday I came to visit and got loaded here. Great scrubby little mission bar to drink beer, shoot pool, throw darts, play that fantastic early '90s San Francisco driving game Midtown Madness. Darts are the best here because the board is crap, the darts look like they got stepped on and the scoreboard is nearly impossible to use, but when you're inebriated, who cares?!
author: Michael E.

description: Quite simply, Kilowatt is a good place to get drunk.  This ex-venue consistently has some of the best priced drinks in the city and the bartenders pour them heavy handedly.  I was there just the other night and a strong whiskey & 7-up was only $3.50.  There are plenty of other ways to amuse oneself at Kilowatt too.  There is a good jukebox, a few pool tables, pinball machines, darts, and it never fails that any conversation can suddenly be interrupted by someone wanting to talk about Metallica.  Ya guy, you know who you are.
author: Broke-Ass Stuart S.

description: Any bar that proudly wears it's hockey badge on its sleeve is okay by me... (even if it's not the Sharks.... the team that upset their beloved RedWings way back in '94)... TVs, pool tables, great jukebox, good selection of beers and a bunch of Red Wings' banners make for a great drop by in this cool part of the city... just make sure you don't step on a pitbull paw on your way in...
author: John M.

description: Kilowatt  is a strange place. From what I hear, it's stuck somewhere between a dive bar and a sports bar -- without being either. The first time I came here, I thought everyone looked familiar (though there WAS a dude I had seen at Zeitgeist earlier). When brought this up to my friend, she said she felt the same. Strange. I like it.
author: Amy Z.

description:
great beer selection. very relaxed with a super sweet jukebox.

ladies if you are single beware there were some seriously uncomfortable looking and acting dudes milling about.

on the plus side i paid for 3 games of pinball(terminator 3 no less) and i won 3 free games. seriously how sweet is 6 for the price of the 3.arnie is workin hard for the people of  cal e for nya(say it out loud)

there is pool too, but if you hit me with your pool cue i will not be your friend
author: Chris G.

description: Everytime I come to this place (which is often because mi amiga lives across the street) I have a ridiculously fun time.  Cheap, loud, fun. Cute dudes and dogs.
author: Rikki D.

description: Although I did not like the crowd, particularly the oddly dressed guy smoking in the doorway leading into the bar, the bar had some promise with cheap drinks and sports memorabilia decorating the walls. I did not stay long enough to comment further, but if I'm in the Mission again, I would give this place a second chance.
author: Michael H.

description: Loud, bad music.  Uninteresting.  Pretty disgusting.  Good place to raise a pig.
author: Kurosh H.

description: Several grand beers on tap here (Racer 5 and Stone!) for cheap located only 1/2 a block away from the ever-so-trendy Delirium.  Plenty of seating and friendly bartenders; there's darts and a pinball machine, too.  Definitely worth stopping by here before or after a night in the Mission.
author: Scott G.

description: I love this bar. It's super chill and people are really down to earth. I also love how they are so dog friendly (I brought my golden-rottweiler mix one night). People naturally had treats on hand to feed him and the drinks are super cheap compared to say going to a club and drinking. The bathrooms aren't yuck status and there is plenty of space to sit and talk with friends. I'd definitely recommend this place to dog lovers and groups that just want to hang and talk or play pool.
author: Alesia T.

description:
i love these cash only bars in the mission. you cant beat the prices and great vibe they provide. that describes hundreds in places in SF. 

How does this place stand out?
chalkboard.

yeah, i said it. this place is cool because it has a giant chalkboard hung high on the ceiling. other than the fact there is a chalkboard, it also has a fine selection of beers listed on the chalkboard.
author: Mike K.

description:
haha i got hit on by this short dude here once. he gave me his number since i refuse to give my number to any boy who is not paul q. that was the night some drunk ass beezy hit my parked car on 18th and guerrero. i hope karma kicks her butt since some passer-bys saw her running from her broke ass car with the front wheel torn off from hitting my car so hard. 

bitch.

oh say what, kilowatt? my friends managed to get their jager bombs here that night since they were on a mission (in the mission aha, aha) to get trashed. but i can see how the pool playing can get annoying if this bar was really crowded.
author: Melanie C.

description: Pretty standard hipster dive bar in the Mission. This place is okay, but I like Dalva & Delirium across the street more.
author: Maria D.

description: When I walked into this joint Muddy Waters was playing, so I was immediately pleased. Kind of a divy/hip feel to it. Shot some pool, drank some beer. Felt very relaxed and at home, didn't really feel like i was in California at all. Could of been somewhere in east coast. Good times though mos def.
author: John P.

description: The beer list is good and competatively priced compared to other bars I frequent, and dogs are allowed (and participants seem well socialized and are used to being drunken therapy dogs)... my only complaint being that after happy hour ends the crowd gets a little creepy and the juke box has an over abundance of punk, thrash, and 90's-i-am-in-denial-of-the-world-around-me metal. While I understand the cool factor of having Turbonegro in the juke, I miss the practicality of the Pixies in a bar like Kilowat.
author: Caroline C.

description: Amy rocks. She's a ray of sunlight in a hipster part of town
author: Big W.

description:
This bar is bitchin'.

Cheap drinks, pool tables, dart boards, games, sweet selection on the juke b., dingy, dusty, dark..

Oh, how I lust dive bars. 

I wish they had Pabst on tap.

Otherwise...
It's lovely.
author: Sheila S.

description: this place is pretty sweet. What really made me love it was the bartender. I was waiting at the bar for like 5 minutes, no big deal, and she told my friend and I that she was sorry for the wait and the drinks were on her. awesome. We ended up loving her and tipping her really well. Her drinks were strong as well, always a plus. Good bartenders like that are hard to come by and Killowatt has atleast one amazing bartender.
author: Bobby P.

description: It's stumbling distance from my bestie's house, they have Hangar 1 lime vodka (my favorite) and a really funny corner booth with a red velvet rope that is reserved for someone (I don't remember who)...that we love to snatch whenever it's available.
author: Emily T.

description: I'm way into the animal friendly factor and it's just a cool bar I like it .. I'll go again
author: Jill W.

description: Sister bar to Zeitgeist.  What can I say about this place?  A little quieter most of the time, a little more room, different beer selection (last time I was there), and an extra pool table with more room.  Is it a beer garden?  No, so that's a bummer.  Otherwise, a treat.
author: Giorgina G.

description: It's Raw. Nobody trying to look pretty here... they just do? (Didn't know where I was going with that, and it's too early in the morning to let myself sound like a dick) What I am trying to say is that it is unpretentious, it is laid back, it is cheap, it is dark, it is a good place to hide from the cops.
author: Lee M.

description: The one time I was here, big-hair bartender, who knew my friend through dating her roommate, looked at us and said, "Your drink is free" pointing to my friend, "but not hers." hers being me! Thanks a lot, chud I don't know!
author: Shannon V.

description: Four stars because a glass of Anchor is $3.75 on a lazy/chill Sunday night, unlike some places that start with a B and end in an S and in the middle is LONDIE. Cool atmosphere, albeit dusty.
author: Maximillian M.

description: In the nexus of my dining, shopping, and barhopping world - 16th and Valencia - there is Kilowatt. When you need to take it easy, play some pool, hang with your friends, just have a mellow time, Kilowatt is there for you. Everyone is friendly and easygoing. One of my favorite things is that they allow dogs, which to me is evidence of how cool this place is.
author: Cyrelle D.

description: Free birthday champagne (ok, cheap sparkling wine) and Polaroids! Darts! Pool! Count me in. Let's hear it for your friendly, dingy Mission bar.
author: Aaron L.

description: Divey, grungy, fun place to stumble into after a place like Skylark. Really refreshing, actually! Plus, despite the sloppy state we were in, they still gave us darts! Hahaha, drunks with sharp objects. Swizz. Also some pool tables, stuff drinks, and a chill crowd. Kind of made me wish we'd come earlier, but hey, that's what the next night is for, right?
author: Irene F.

description: Although Kilowatt was rather loud, crowded (unexpected because every time I've walked by this bar it's been essentially empty), and playing terrible music, it wins some major points for having a clean ladies' room, cheap drinks ($3.50 for beer and well drinks), it's own ATM  ($1.50 fee), and dogs.
author: charlotte c.

description: Best bloody mary's around ! ! !
author: Jade B.

description: Cool: pinball, pacman, pool tables, relaxed - nothing but sausage in here so that works out great for me!
author: Mimi X.

description: If you go there around 9 pm, you can get a booth, otherwise by 1130 pm it is get mad crowded. It's spacious and there is a lot of interesting stuff on the walls. It's def a good start off place for your mission bar crawl.
author: Anita C.

description: This is a pretty good bar.  Not pretentious at all, and generally a pretty good vibe.  It is a good place to go in the mission if you actually want to be able to hear what your friends are saying.  The beer is decent.
author: Joanna S.

description: It's div-y and cheap for the area. I like that a lot. Well drinks $4, good pints of beer $3.50ish. The jukebox was mostly loaded with heavy music, but the crowd was a generic mix of people. Not  what you might expect from the multiple Misfits albums on display. I played Johnny Cash and Cheap Trick. We also played pool - it was pretty easy to get a table even though it was a Saturday night. My friend fell in love with a tall Uma Thurman look alike killing it at the pool table in strappy high heels. Oh, and the bartender was a very sweet lgal who - although she accused us of smuggling in nips - didn't get mad when we dropped a glass. :)
author: Kathleen D.

description: True dive.....good drinks and unique crowd, but the music tries too hard.  Been here 20 times at least and have yet to recognize 1 song!
author: Greg R.

description: This has to be one of my top three bars in the city.  Cheap drinks, an awesome staff and not too many of the young hipsters, Kilowatt is very welcoming and pleasant to hang out in on the weekends when a lot of the other Mission area bars are filled with drunken 21-year-old Irishmen on holiday.  Great beer selection to boot.
author: MonkeyPants S.

description: Stopped in this past Saturday night to check it out and I thought it was a pretty nice dive bar (I know oxymoron). Fun atmosphere, they have pool tables and darts. Good place to hang with some friends. No dancing though so we didn't stay long and went up the street to Double Dutch.
author: Jenny C.

description:
At times this bar reeks of the type of douchebag who is overly infatuated with their new iPhone, but don't let that color your decision to come check it out because for the most part, those people are panned by the door and waitstaff unless they recognize you as a repeat patron.
The bartenders are quite adept in realizing who is cheating and ordering drinks for strangers who are cutting in line, and that's pretty cool. There's usually an awesome pinball game in the back, that is rarely played, and the sparce bathroom situation is really democratic for both men and women because everyone is usually cracking jokes if there is a line. If you have a booth and want to go outside to smoke, even if the bar is crowded, nearly everyone recognizes the universal "covered drink marks my space" and won't try to steal your seat too, unlike a lot of other bars in the area which also service the increasing bridge-and-tunnel influx.
author: Sam A.

description:
i love this bar.  jukeboxwise, this is the best place to go if you dont wanna hear a buncha that hipster garbage that seems to be so prevalent these days:  a lot of hard rock/punk/metal, and if it gets slow or quiet, the bartenders are kind enough to put their own personal collections on.  

there is also something about the atmosphere.  im not talking about the cool-as-shit bartenders that are pretty good about getting to you in a timely manner, or the pool tables that have hosted more than its fair share of drunken dates, or the dartboards, or the pinball machines, or the booth seats, or the HD screens constantly broadcasting espn or FSN bay area... 

im talking about the people.  for some reason, entering the Watt is like entering a parallel universe where everyone is up for conversation and is nice to you.  there is just seriously something about this place, i dont know what it is, but i can tell you right now its great enough to lure me out of my neighborhood and trek three districts over to get here.
author: Jon H.

description: Short of having an actual Green Bay bar in San Francisco, this is the best place I've found to watch the Packers play on Sundays.  The beer list is extensive, the prices are dirt cheap, there are dogs walking around everywhere, the music is generally good, the bartenders are quick, and they have pinball.  These are the marks of a quality bar.
author: Barry Z.

description: Sorry I got sloppy last night and fell, sorry for the tequila shot, sorry for the hour it took me to get money out of the ATM. HOWEVER, the bartenders here are ALWAYS great. Carla you literally poured a shot that knocked me on my ass. Next time i will behave. Great scene, not pretentious, pool tables, nice crowd, good vibe. I have always had a great time here and been treated above and beyond well.
author: victoria h.

description: I dig Kilowatt!  It's laid back and full of "real people" who just want to hang out and have a beer.  The place is huge with tons of tv's and places to sit.  I wasn't too fond of the bathroom, but it was functional and decent.
author: Wella A.

description: I love walls of mirrors.  I don't much love dogs, but it's entertaining to be able to bring them here.  And who doesn't love post-kickballers?
author: Nelson A.

description: I enjoy my beer with canine company so I like coming to Kilowatt. There is always at least one dog roaming around. I realize this is not a selling point for some, including my friend who was eying the dogs suspiciously and kept saying "Isn't that a health code violation?" Decent beer selections on tap, unpretentious bartenders. Kilowatt  is also a good place to go and watch hockey,  if that kind of thing floats your boat.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Speakeasy Ale on tap and cheap pints is the best thing this place has got going for it. Oh yeah, and CAKE in the jukebox.
author: Lauren S.

description: Randomly walked into this bar one night.  Sat at the bar, good assortment of beers, I think I had an apple cider.  Cool stop on a MIssion area bar crawl.
author: Nicole C.

description: Pitchers of cold beer with two dart boards and Guns and Roses blasting from the speakers.  Couldn't ask for more...
author: Mark D.

description: Cheap beer, plus a good selection on tap.  Found a table free without waiting.  Nothing to get excited about, but pretty mellow.  Lots more space than some of the other places on the block.
author: Aaron T.

description: Ahh, dive bar goodness. Somehow I always manage to have a fantastic time here. Part of that is the people I've come with, but Kilowatt has everything you need to make a quality bar experience: a solid beer selection, cheap drinks, and laid-back, unpretentious people. This is a come-as-you-are bar, and I definitely appreciated that after a night in the Marina that quickly brought me back to my days of frat parties. And hey, if you get bored it's not like there's no other bars on 16th...
author: Kristen B.

description: Usually when I escape from the sweaty pit that is Delerium, I find myself at this somewhat more laid back bar. The jukebox is awesome, and the door guys are really nice (and once kicked out a dude that tried to beat me up at Delerium....what, he started it!)
author: Veronica B.

description: A bit too much of a hipster scene for me but a solid bar none the less. I would only give it 3 stars but the terminator pinball in the back tacks on the 4th. I mean you can shoot ping pong balls on the top
author: Roxane S.

description: I love this place!  It's grungy, they've got great beer on tap, I mean great, one of the best selections I've found.  When the Seahawks were in the playoffs last year, I'd go here every weekend to watch the game.  It's where all the Seattle fans hung out.  Now that's saying something, the cool Seattle fans.  Not the sports bar geeks but the real, authentic, feel-it-with-your-soul kind of love.  Actually, I'm not even much of a football guy but it was great fun.
author: Abendigo R.

description: So, the Kilowatt is responsible for us having Clyde, our dog.  I've always liked the Kilowatt so we went there one night last January for a friend's birthday.  Good people, good music, not pretentious, and the free B-day champagne is a bonus.  Well, that night there was a very well behaved pitbull just cruising around the bar gettin' all sorts of love from anyone who would give it.  We were already thinking about getting a dog, we'd even been to the SPCA a few times to look, but we were a little scared to take the big step of actually getting one.  Well, that dog, I can't remember his name, made up our minds for us.  The next day we went and got Clyde and I can't imagine what it would be like without him.  So, I just wanted to say thank you to that dog, and to the Kilowatt for being so cool as to let a dog wander their bar.
author: Jeffrey F.

description: A little on the divey side, Kilowatt is pretty much a standard bar with a pool table.  I do like how they allow dogs in there.
author: Tim G.

description:
it's roomy, above all else. plenty of space to sit down and lots of pool tables, with relatively high ceilings

the crowd is a mixed bag as most are in the mission, can't decide if it's trendy or casual but it'll do

came here for a birthday thing a couple weeks ago, had a great time and was able to hold conversations without yelling, which is always a plus
author: Charles C.

description: I just moved right down the street, and I feel like this laid-back spot has a chance to become the place where everybody knows my name.  It has that chill neighborhood vibe going on, and pool tables and dart boards for those who like a little action with their beer (they served good mixed drinks too).  Weekends get a bit crowded, but never overwrought like some other Mission bars, and weeknights are great for a drink with a friend after work.
author: Rachel B.

description: Kilowatt rules.  You know why?  Cuz it's a bar -- nothing more, nothing less.  Awesome beer selection, cheap drinks/pitchers ($13 for Trumer Pils on a Saturday night), pool, darts, and a lot of good people chilling.  They keeps it real!  It's a great place to pre-funk before going somewhere else, or totally fine to stay there and get your swerve on until 2am (note: see review on Cable Car Pizza...that was right after Kilowatt).  The men's bathroom is awkward and small, and dirty, but whatever...not going there to hang out.  At least there were paper towels all night.  Thumbs up if you're looking for a bar and a great place to hang out with your peeps.  Not sure about the barking dogs in there last night, but whatever...anything goes.
author: Louis M.

description: I'm not positive what it is I love about this bar but the important thing is I love it. I have never had a bad experience here. Even when it's crowded as hell I don't have to wait very long for a drink, the place is not frequented by assholes (huge bonus) and there's a general vibe of joy and good times. What's not to like?
author: C P.

description: I like Kilowatt better than almost any bar around 16th Street. I guess because they have good beers and they have booze which is nice. Also I like the wooden booth seats, they're nice and cozy. Also it's a great place to go and play pool! Lots of room! Also, they play pretty rockin' music and they also have darts. Overall, I enjoy the people who hang out there and sure there's hipsters, but really, not as many as in other bars.
author: Gina R.

description: Usually I sneak over here when everyone is hanging out across the street at Gestalt.  I can get a real drink and hear some decent tunes-- like old some Metallica.   I've never had a bad drink here and I feel like the service is pretty quick.
author: Jessica T.

description: First place I've found to watch hockey in the city without feeling like a frat-party date rape was lurking just around the bend. Repeat after me aloud "sports bars" and feel that shiver that runs down your spine. Yeah, well I don't get that vibe from Kilowatt. Add to that I didn't get run out of the joint for rooting on the Flyers while they were playing the Sharks. Hockey+metal+garage+good beer+good folk=Kilowatt. Thanks to the charmingly raucous Edmonton fan/Hemlock bartender for the recommendation.
author: Rob S.

description: This place is the epitome of a great dive bar.  Cheap drinks, a friendly and eclectic clientele, fun bartenders, and it's not too crowded even on a Saturday.  There are TVs and pool tables to keep you entertained too.  Definitely worth a visit, or two, or three....
author: Shannon L.

description: I havent been here yet but I cant add it to my list of dog friendly places unless I have a review. Ill edit my star rating and review once I visit the place (this weekend perhaps). Until then 5 stars just for allowing dogs :)
author: Brando Calrissian ..

description: One of my favorite places to get a drink.  Just walk up from the 16th St. Bart Station.  Definitely hockey friendly during the season (especially if yer a Red Wings fan with all the banners around)  and a pretty happening place during the night.   Good service as well.  Jukebox during the day, but at night, they'll tend play stuff on the CD player.
author: Richie W.

description: I really like this place-- drinks are cheap ($4 for tap, $7 for my fave mixed drink), dogs are welcome, and outside food (well, leftovers, anyway) is okay, too.  There are two billiards tables and one jukebox, which is unfortunately filled primarily with rock selections.  Oh, there's a change machine, too, that takes $1 and $5 bills (perfect for Muni riders or parking meters).
author: Lynn O.

description: I like it down the street better, at delirium, gestalt or double dutch.  I think it's just not really my style of bar.  I would rather be somewhere packed.
author: Matt N.

description: This is hands down my favorite bar in the mission. It's a cool place to just kick it with some friends, play some pool, and drink cheap, good beer. People there are friendly, as are the bartenders. It's defnitely a low-key vibe, not really a "get wasted/blackout drunk" kinda place, but I'm sure if you want it to be that kind of night, you could make it that way. I love it more because one of the bartenders gave me a free pitcher for being nice when it was crowded. Every weekend I try to rally the troops to go to Kilowatt. It's that great.
author: Lauren K.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city, and definitely of the Mission. Great beer choice (Racer 5 on tap is a rarity), lots of action and a very good jukebox. Plenty of TV's to watch your favorite game while you are waiting for your reservation in one of the many fine local restaurants. I used to go here when it was the "Firehouse". Too bad they had to stop live bands from playing there because some of them would wreck the equipment, but, they still have a couple of pinball machines which is another rarity these days.
author: Rich M.

description: Four stars for the beer menu and spunky bartendress. One star for the atmosphere and clientele. Three stars for being able to go there with a group and be rowdy, but zero stars for being hit on by really uninteresting, unattractive people. We'll pretend that averages to like, two stars.
author: Jordan B.

description: Amazing bar with very friendly staff, dog friendly, reasonable prices, two dart boards two tables and a great
author: Mike G.

description: Any place where a man and his best friend can share a pint of suds gets my attention. Five stars just for being dog friendly, minus one for the not so tastey ??? ????? I had, plus one star for having like fifteen more beers to choose from.
author: t h.

description: Our favorite Mission hangout.  Reasonably priced drinks, good pours, and a decent beer-on-tap selection.  Great mix of people, and pool tables are usually available on all but the busiest of nights.  I like the music that is being played on the jukebox.  I've had friends bitch about it, but I like the harder, edgier stuff.
author: Scott G.

description: Pretty cheap drinks and cool booths. It's really the booths that do it for me. Perfect for cozying up under the red light and getting to know someone. And then, of course if that doesn't pan out, you can get your hustle on at the pool tables.
author: Matt L.

description: I love this place for the atmosphere and beer selection. Unfortunately it often smells bad. I have had some great bartenders and some shitty ones. The only reason for the less than great rating is the one bartender that had to spend 10 minutes smoking outside and then 5 minutes talking to her friends instead of doing her job, which I presume is serving beer. I will happily change my review if circumstances allow it. I think it it is great that you can bring your dog!
author: tim s.

description: A great place to go in the early afternoon, either to watch a game or just hang out and shoot the schtuff. Come eveningtime, it becomes damn near impossible to get around and unless standing next to a pool table with your drink held over your head so some knucklehead doesn't run into it sounds like a blast to you, avoid the 'watt at night.
author: Andrew L.

description: Very good selection of beers on tap.  Casual crowd. Small coin-op pool tables are popular though I don't play myself.  Located close to several food options if you happen to get hungry after a few brews.
author: Christopher K.

description: I went  to watch the Pats-Jags playoff game and it was a good crowd, and something like $2.50 Racer 5 pints, and some guy was buying drinks for me and the person next to me, and I might have rolled something at the bar.  I've been back a few time since, on weekday nights, and ts been just as fun.   There are usually a few dogs there, and one night me and my friends tried to play darts but the board was warped.  They have 'Return to Cookie Mountain' on the jukebox so I'm happy.  Also good mix of people hangout there.
author: Thomas G.

description: A really cool bar, with one of the best jukeboxes in the neighborhood. They got pool, darts, and a really nice atmosphere. Love this place
author: Venkat K.

description: Pretty typical mission bar, but nothing special. It smell kinda funny and they let dogs come in. I am not a huge fan, but there is a pool table and the beer isn't too expensive.
author: P-nut K.

description: Who knew this place was so cool. Went for the first time last night, totally pleased with the large space, cheap drinks, and chill crowd. Just a few blocks up the street from where I live, this could be my new dive bar of choice. $7 for two gin and tonics? Yeah, I'll be back.
author: Jason B.

description:
my experience here is summed up by some jerk telling my friend and i 'go get retarded somewhere else'.  and by that he meant 'go back to the marina'.  i dont think jeans and a hoodie makes for a marina outfit - and i dont think people should be so rude.

i also don't think dogs belong in bars. but they did have a good beer selection and the bartenders seemed friendly enough.
author: jessie h.

description: The Kilowatt has 2 pool tables with plenty of playing room.  I hate bars where they have tables, but it's so cramped you feel like an A-hole when you play cuz you're hitting peolple in the back of the head with your stick. I had a great car bomb there. Ambiance is cozy, humble, slightly divvy.  Crowd is nice, young, interesting, and mixed.  In a great location with eats everywhere of every kind right out the door.  Right across from Roxy Theater.
author: robin c.

description: Stumbled upon this place when visiting San Francisco.  I was looking for a taco, but a beer sounded better.  Cheers to afternoon happy hour!
author: Maret W.

description:
cheap happy hour, no fake tans, no bright white teeth

kind of fun to get wasted next to a dog.
author: Cheester O.

description: This place reminds me of Cheers the t.v. show. Everyone there is chill with no worries just drinks n pool. It's for everyone and anyone. Yeah!
author: Richard D.

description: ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE SERVICE! I went here the other Sunday night and the woman bartender could not make a simple mixed drink I had asked her to. When I told her she had made it wrong she gave me a bunch of unnecessary attitude and gave me my money back and told me to "scram" out of her bar. When i asked her why, she said "because my drink is stupid and she doesn't have time for it." Sorry, but last time I checked I thought a bartender was suppose to know how to make drinks and serve them to customers ATTITUDE FREE! THIS WAS BY FAR THE WORST EXPERIENCE IN A BAR I'VE EVER HAD! DO NOT GO!
author: Amanda L.

description: The Bar was nice, but the ladies bathrooms were terrific! Very clean and well lit  with a sparkling sink.  Thank you kilowatt for having the nicest bathroom of any dive bars I've been to.
author: Hilary P.

description: OMG, it's been years since I've been here but I remember it like it was yesterday. I dated a boy who lived very close to here for a while and this was a typical weekend watering hole for us. I used to be a huge lush and he was a big cokehead...a match made in heaven you could say. Except it was not. Anyway, one night I got so shitfaced I threw up in my drink glass and then ran to the bathroom to continue the dramz. When I came back, homie started cackling like a wildman and had the crazy eye. I was like "WTF is wrong with you?" and he told me, "when you went to the bathroom, I took a drink out of your glass and someone told me you puked in it!" and then continued the crazy laughter. He practically screamed it to the bar and I know if I just drank someone's puke, I would not make a PSA out of it. As far as the bar goes, I don't remember it because 7  years ago I was too busy puking into glasses and having my ex boyfriend drink it.
author: Jade L.

description: its in my hood so stumbling home is easy! great place, hot bartenders, nice pool tables. on sunday night they have free pool so you need to be good in order to actually play more than one game. Gotta love the dive bars...
author: Susan M.

description: Good people, plenty of TV's and they have all the sports subscriptions, kickass metal/punk/etc. music, great dogs that are allowed to hang out.
author: Danny C.

description: kind of a bright area it seemed like. pool table. maybe more than 1. i was drunk so i dont remember. there were different levels to the place. like how kramer wanted to make his apt. in an episode of seinfeld. they were rude to me at the end of the night when they tried to kick everyone out.
author: Victor B.

description: i claim that i got roofied here because i only bought one beer and was wasted halfway through it.  though thinking back, i was probably wasted because i had had 5 drinks prior to kilowatt.  hooray for no roofies and cheap beers, boo for the crowded, blazered bro-y scene.
author: Katherine K.

description: reclaiming sports from frat boy kakhidom, kilowatt merges punk rock with loving the fuck out of your team!  the bar opens at kickoff during football season, and it's the only place i know of where fully sleeved tattoed guys and gals wear their home team jerseys and watch football games with slayer or metallica ripping through the sound sytem!  add some of andy's great bloody marys to remind you of last night and it is heaven.
author: church B.

description: i love this place for the no frills attitude it exudes. the floor is also  perpetually sticky-looking. that's about all i can say for a place i'm generally too wasted to remember much about.
author: Angie Y.

description: Kilowatt was cool in the begining.  I have to say though my first time there years ago someone threw a cherry bomb in the door and scared us all shitless and it was a while before I went back.  Just because the crowd was kind of rough.  Well it was packed when most places on the street so obviously it has staying power and good for them.  It's a good place for all the reasons people mentioned.
author: Misti L.

description: Great place to grab a few drinks, throw some darts, watch a sporting event or 2 on one of the many flat screen tvs or just shoot the shit with some cool cats.  Unlike Molotovs, which admittedly doesn't aspire to be quite the same, Kilowatt manages to be punk without trying too hard.  I think this is due to the fact that the crowd is generally a bit older and doesn't need to try so hard, but also because people here enjoy sports which creates a bit more of a bond amongst the crowd.  The fact that dogs are often cruising around the place is pretty cool, too, but I've also almost killed one or two by stepping on them unintentionally, so if you bring yours along at least let people know it's on the floor lest it be smooshed by a size 12 Doc Martin.
author: Travis F.

description: My home away from home.  Actually, just began returning to this watering hole like a prodigal son.  New bartenders now, (ah, the days of Phred, Danielle, Neil, Julie... whereout thou Danielle?  I miss coffee and a pop-tart on Sunday morns' with you!)
author: Marcel C.

description: Okay, I've passed by this bar at least three hundred times because it's on the way home. I have only one question: has a non-white person EVER gone in this bar? I mean all I see are these scary looking white biker dudes standing outside and sometimes a few skater girls. Do we really need a bar in the Mission where you have to own a Harley to be able to go inside? I would go to this bar to actually check it out, but I'm honestly scared to do so given the clientle. Maybe I am not being fair, but it's pretty odd that the people who frequent this bar are so out there. I would not recommend this place if you are gay or a minority, but I hope I'm wrong.
author: Hmmm W.

description: die hard redwings bar. enough said.
author: Dean E.

description: It's a home away from home...  I love this place.  Everyone that works here rocks!  Fridays can suck when all the marina folk try to slum it in the mission.
author: Darcy M.

description: looks like a dive from the outside - wish they weren't closed on the 4th of july.
author: Tre S.

description: I love this place! Not only can I get a top shelf cocktail for $4, it's the perfect spot to chill with friends and locals. They have a great jukebox, but even when the music's turned way up you can usually find a spot to hold a conversation and actually hear everyone. The bartenders are no-nonsense, but friendly. They pour a good drink and you can't beat the price. One of my favorite Mission haunts.
author: Misha L.

description: Best damned pool bar in the Mission. 2 tables. $0.50 each. Really good people play there though, so be warned. You'll probably get whooped.
author: Dan R.
